ufens: <entryFree id="n49629" type="main" key="U_fens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ūfens</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Oufens</orth>, ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=194" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 194</bibl> Müll.), <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n49629.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small river in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that flows past Tarracina</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ufente</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:802" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 802</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:383" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 383</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ūfentīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Oufent-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Ufens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ufentine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus,</quote> <trans><tr>one of the thirty-five Roman tribes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 20, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=194" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 194</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49629.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A man's name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:745" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 745</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:339" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 339</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:343" default="NO">4, 343</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uffugum: <entryFree id="n49630" type="main" key="Uffugum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Uffugum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n49630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in the territory of the Bruttii</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Fagnano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ulceraria: <entryFree id="n49631" type="main" key="ulce^ra_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ulcĕrārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. herba) [ulcus], <sense id="n49631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant horehound</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ulceratio: <entryFree id="n49632" type="main" key="ulce^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ulcĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ulcero</etym>, <sense id="n49632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breaking out into sores</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ulceration; a sore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ulcer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 11, 27, § 115</bibl> (dub.; al. exulcerationes). —In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 6:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 6, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ulcero: <entryFree id="n49633" type="main" key="ulce^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ulcĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ulcus</etym>, <sense id="n49633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make sore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to ulcerate</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n49633.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum ulcerato Philocteta serpentis morsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:16:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 16, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mantica cui lumbos onere ulceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 106</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n49633.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: non ancilla tuum jecur ulceret<cb n="ULCU" />  ulla, i. e. <hi rend="ital">wound with love</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ulcerosus: <entryFree id="n49634" type="main" key="ulce^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ulcĕrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ulcus</etym>, <sense id="n49634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of sores</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ulcerous</hi> (very rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n49634.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49634.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of trees, <hi rend="ital">knobby</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of knots</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 106</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n49634.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: jecur, i. e. <hi rend="ital">wounded</hi> (with love), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:25:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 25, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ulcisco: <entryFree id="n49635" type="main" key="ulcisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ulcisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. ulciscor <sense id="n49635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ulciscor: <entryFree id="n49636" type="main" key="ulciscor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ulciscor</orth>, <itype>ultus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n49636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. dep.</hi> [etym. dub.]. </sense><sense id="n49636.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To avenge one's self on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take vengeance on</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">punish</hi> for wrong done (very freq. and class.; cf.: vindico, punio, persequor). </sense><sense id="n49636.2" n="A" level="2"> With a personal object: <cit><quote lang="la">ego pol illum ulciscar hodie Thessalum veneficum, Qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego illum fame, ego illum Siti, maledictis, malefactis, amatorem Ulciscar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pro scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulciscendi Romanos pro iis, quas acceperant, injuriis occasio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odi hominem et odero: utinam ulcisci possem! sed illum ulciscentur mores sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam illum res publica suo jure esset ulta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:33:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 33, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ego non tam ulcisci studeo, quam sanare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos intellegis non, ut per te alium, sed ut per alium aliquem te ipsum ulciscantur, laborare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victos acerbius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 42:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 42, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alphesiboea suos ulta est pro conjuge fratres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:15:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 15, 15</bibl></cit> (19): <cit><quote lang="la">ulta pellicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 63</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inimici ulciscendi causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus casūs, quem ulciscitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">has tris ulciscendi rationes Taurus scriptas reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:14:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 14, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49636.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take revenge for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to avenge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punish</hi> injustice, wrongs, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">with a non-personal object: quā in re Caesar non solum publicas sed etiam privatas injurias ultus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuerunt, istius injurias per vos ulcisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">injurias rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etruscorum injurias bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:21:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 21, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alii ulcisci dolorem aliquem suum vellent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:20:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:28:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 28, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccata peccatis et injurias injuriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:27:81 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 27, 81 al.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ultum ire injurias festinare,</quote> <trans><tr>to proceed to revenge</tr>, <tr>to revenge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 68:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 68, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultum ire scelera et injurias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istius nefarium scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:27:section=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 27, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrui mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senis iracundiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensas tuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:134" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbaras Regum libidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illatum a Persis Graeciae bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 15, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49636.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, with the person to whom wrong has been done as the object, <hi rend="ital">to take vengeance for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to avenge</hi> a person (much less freq. but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quos nobis poëtae tradiderunt patris ulciscendi causā supplicium de matre sumpsisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 16, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesos fratres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:603" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 603</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:442" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrem justa per arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:710" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 710</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numen utrumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:574" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 574</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadentem patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 576</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (armis) possis te ulcisci lacessitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 14, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:40:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 40, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 397</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 8, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibal se a transfugis ultus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:16:4" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 16, 4</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">a ferro sanguis humanus se ulciscitur: contactum namque eo celerius subinde rubiginem trahit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 41, § 146</bibl></cit>.—With the two constructions combined: <cit><quote lang="la">non hercle ego is sum, qui sum, ni hanc injuriam meque ultus pulcre fuero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.!*? </sense><sense id="n49636.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ulcisco</orth>, ĕre: nisi patrem materno sanguine exanclando ulciscerem, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 292, 16</bibl> (Trag. v. 184 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n49636.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ulciscor</orth>, <itype>ci</itype>, in a passive signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid sine sanguine civium ulcisci nequitur, jure factum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 8</bibl></cit>: ob iras graviter ultas, graviter ultae, Liv 2, 17, 7; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ultus,</quote> <trans><tr>avenged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:753" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 753</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulta ossa patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ulcus: <entryFree id="n49637" type="main" key="ulcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ulcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hulc-</orth>), <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">e(/lkos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n49637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ulcer.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49637.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 26</bibl>, n. 31; 5, 28, n. 6 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 6, 60, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:161" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 9, 81, § 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:103" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 23, 49, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1166" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 454</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:113 al" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 113 al.</bibl>—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcus tangere,</quote> <trans><tr>to touch a sore spot</tr>, <tr>touch on a delicate subject</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49637.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of trees, <hi rend="ital">an excrescence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 227</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">montium hulcera,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>marble quarries</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 125</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49637.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: ulcus (i. e. <cb n="ULLU" /> amor) enim vivescit et inveterascit alendo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1068" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1068</bibl>: quicquid horum attigeris, ulcus est, <hi rend="ital">it will prove a sore place</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">will turn out absurd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:37:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 37, 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tu in hoc ulcere tamquam inguen exsisteres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 5, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ulcusculum: <entryFree id="n49638" type="main" key="ulcuscu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ulcuscŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ulcus</etym>, <sense id="n49638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small sore</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ulcer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 72:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 72, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 19, 78, § 259</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ulex: <entryFree id="n49639" type="main" key="ulex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ulex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shrub resembling rosemary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ulia: <entryFree id="n49640" type="main" key="Uli^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ulĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n49640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of</hi> Hispania Baetica, Auct. B. Hisp. 3; Auct. B. Alex. 61; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uliginosus: <entryFree id="n49641" type="main" key="u_li_gi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūlīgĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>uligo</etym>, <sense id="n49641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of moisture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">damp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">marshy</hi> (syn. umidus): <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:6:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 5, 3, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caprile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscera,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dropsical</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 30</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūlīgĭnōsa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. loca), <hi rend="ital">swamps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">marshes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 23, 55, § 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uligo: <entryFree id="n49642" type="main" key="u_li_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūlīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contr. from uviligo, from uveo, uvens, uvesco, uvidus, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n49642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moisture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">marshy quality</hi> of the earth (syn. umor), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:9" default="NO">2, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 184</bibl>; cf. Serv. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:381" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 381</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ulixes: <entryFree id="n49643" type="main" key="U^lixes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŭlixes</orth> (sometimes, on account of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*)odusseu/s</foreign>, erroneously written <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŭlys-ses</orth>), <itype>is</itype> (also Ulixei, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 16, 13</bibl>; also, <sense id="n49643.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">by synizesis, Ulixei, trisyl.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 159</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 671</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 24</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, Ulixi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 273</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 63</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>from the Etruscan Uluxe, or from the Siculian <foreign lang="greek">*ou)li/chs</foreign>; v. Müll. Etrusk. 2, p. 279</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the Latin name for Odysseus</hi>, Engl. <hi rend="ital">Ulysses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Ithaca</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famed among the Grecian heroes of the Trojan war for his craft and eloquence; the son of Laertes and Anticlea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husband of Penelope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Telemachus and Telegonus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 98</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 21, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 31, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:12:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 12, 25</bibl> (4, 11, 23) sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 6, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ullatenus: <entryFree id="n49644" type="main" key="ulla_te^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ullātĕnus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>ullus-tenus</etym>, <sense id="n49644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in any respect whatever</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 1, 21</bibl>; Greg. Ep. 2, 8.</sense></entryFree>
ullus: <entryFree id="n49645" type="main" key="ullus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ullus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um; <sense id="n49645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> ullīus; <case>dat.</case> ulli (<hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> ulli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 38</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [for unulus, <lbl>dim.</lbl> of unus], <hi rend="ital">any</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any one</hi> (usu. in neg. sentences; corresp. with aliquis in affirmations). </sense><sense id="n49645.1" n="I" level="1"> In negative declarations (so most usually): <cit><quote lang="la">neque praeter te in Alide ullus servus istoc nomine est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vobis auctor ullus est nec vosmet estis ulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ulla deformior species est civitatis quam illa, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 34, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulium, inquam, horum (signorum) reliquit, neque aliud ullum tamen, praeter unum pervetus ligneum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā aliā in civitate ... ullum domicilium libertas habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:31:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 31, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cluentii nummus nullus judici datus ullo vestigio reperietur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:36:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 36, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnino nemo ullius rei fuit emptor, cui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 38, 97</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem quidem adeo infatuare potuit, ut ei nummum ullum crederet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non possum equidem dicere, me ullā in cogitatione, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:22:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 22, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve ipse navem ullam praeter duos lembos haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 35, 5</bibl></cit>.—After sine: <cit><quote lang="la">ut plane sine ullo domino sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 43, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus sine ullā facultate navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:3:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullo maleficio iter per provinciam facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 11, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">negant sapientem suscepturum ullam rei publicae partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communis lex naturae, quae vetat ullam rem esse cujusquam, nisi ejus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 27</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Esp., haud ullus, non ullus, emphat. for nullus: di sciunt, culpam meam istanc non esse ullam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinceps explicatur differentia rerum, quam si non ullam esse diceremus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:15:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 15, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:90:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 90, 112</bibl>; cf.: non ullam rem aliam extimescens, quam, etc., Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 18, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ille honorem a pueritiā ... non ullum existimationis bonae fructum umquam cogitarat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 13, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:44:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 44, 128</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virus haud ullum magis noxium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49645.2" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">any one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anybody</hi>, etc. (rare but class.): <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Quasi non sit intus (erus)! <hi rend="ital">Am.</hi> Neque pol est, neque ullus quidem huc venit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 10</bibl>: nec ulli <pb n="1925" /> <cb n="ULPI" /> verbo male dicat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 1, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam ulli supplicabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negat se more et exemplo populi Romani posse iter ulli per provinciam dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec prohibente ullo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 40, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quam societatem cum ullo Cretensium aut quodam alio institueret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 35, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reor non ullis, si vita longior daretur, posset esse jucundior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ullis aut gloria major aut augustior honor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49645.3" n="B" level="2"> In questions implying a negation (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">est ergo ulla res tanti, aut commodum ullum tam expetendum, ut viri boni nomen amittas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 20, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an deus est ullus suavis Suaviatio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui nescio an ulla pars operis hujus sit magis elaborata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49645.4" n="C" level="2"> In hypothetical clauses: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc si ullus deus amaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ullo pacto ille huc conciliari potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si posset ullo modo impetrari ut abiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ullo modo est ut possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atqui si tempus est ullum jure hominis necandi, quae multa sunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ulla mea apud te commendatio valuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filio meo, si erit ulla res publica, satis, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ullam partem libertatis tenebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:5:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vero non ulla tibi facta est injuria, sine scelere eum accusare non potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:18:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 18, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49645.5" n="II" level="1"> In affirmative clauses (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. not in Cic.): ita fustibus sum mollior miser magis, quam ullus cinaedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra quam ullus spiritus durare possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum amnes ulli rumpuntur fontibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam scelus intra se tacitum qui cogitat ullum, Facti crimen habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:209" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 209</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ulmarium: <entryFree id="n49646" type="hapax" key="ulma_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ulmārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ulmus</etym>, <sense id="n49646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plantation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nursery of elms</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 15, § 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ulmeus: <entryFree id="n49647" type="main" key="ulme^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ulmĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an elm-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of elm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elm-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:141" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 141</bibl></cit>: virgae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">rods for whipping with</hi>, Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 478</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tibi subnectabant rure huc virgas ulmeas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 74</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">virgidemia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigmenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: mihi tibique interminatu'st, nos futuros ulmeos, nisi, etc., <hi rend="ital">that we shall be changed into elm-rods</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">shall be soundly scourged</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 96</bibl>; cf. the foll. art. and ulmus.</sense></entryFree>
ulmitriba: <entryFree id="n49648" type="greek" key="ulmi^tri^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ulmĭtrĭba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vox hibrida, from ulmus and <foreign lang="greek">tri/bw</foreign>, tero</etym>, an elm-rubber, i. e. <sense id="n49648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that wears out elms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is often beaten with elm-rods</hi>, a term of abuse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 7</bibl>; cf. ulmus.</sense></entryFree>
ulmus: <entryFree id="n49649" type="main" key="ulmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ulmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n49649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 54</bibl>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <hi rend="ital">an elm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elm-tree.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49649.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 15, § 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 446</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 100</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 661</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 15, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:8 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 8 al.</bibl>— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vitis) conjuncta ulmo marito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49649.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: ulmorum Acheruns, <hi rend="ital">the Acheron of elm-rods</hi>, of one who is often beaten, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 2, 9</bibl>; cf. ulmitriba: Falernae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Falernian vines</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">Falernian wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:150" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 150</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viduae,</quote> <trans><tr>without vines</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 78</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ulna: <entryFree id="n49650" type="main" key="ulna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ulna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">w)le/nh</foreign>; Goth. aleina; Germ. Elle; cf. Ellenbogen; Engl. ell</etym>, <sense id="n49650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the elbow.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49650.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 43, 98, § 243</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n49650.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49650.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">the arm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tremula patris dormientis in ulnā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 18</bibl> (3, 10), 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:847" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 847</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 652</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 664</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:457" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 457</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:499" default="NO">10, 499</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:266 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 266 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n49650.4" n="B" level="2"> As a measure of length. </sense><sense id="n49650.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An ell</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 355</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:8" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:748" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 748</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n49650.6" n="2" level="3"> As much as a man can clasp with both arms, <hi rend="ital">a fathom</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 76, § 202</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ulophonon: <entryFree id="n49651" type="greek" key="u_lo^pho^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūlŏphŏnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ov)lofo/non</foreign>, <sense id="n49651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a variety of the plant</hi> chamaeleon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 18, 21, § 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ulpianus: <entryFree id="n49652" type="main" key="Ulpi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ulpĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: Domitius Ulpianus, <sense id="n49652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Roman jurist under the emperors Septimius Severus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Caracalla</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Heliogabalus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Alexander Severus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fragments of whose writings are found in the Pandects; he was murdered in Gaul</hi>, A. D. 230, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 16, § 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ulpicum: <entryFree id="n49653" type="main" key="ulpi^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ulpĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n49653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of leek</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:113" default="NO">10, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ulpius: <entryFree id="n49654" type="main" key="Ulpius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ulpius</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. So esp., M. Ulpius Trajanus, <hi rend="ital">the celebrated Roman emperor of that name.</hi>—Hence, <cb n="ULTE" /> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ulpĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Ulpius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 8, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
uls: <entryFree id="n49655" type="main" key="uls"><orth extent="full" lang="la">uls</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ouls</orth>; <sense id="n49655.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <pos>prep.</pos> with <case>acc.</case> [from the pronominal root il, whence ille], <hi rend="ital">beyond;</hi> opp. to cis (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">uls Cato pro ultra posuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=379" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 379</bibl></cit> Müll.: ouls lucum facutalem (followed by cis lucum Esquilinum), Form. Sacr. Argeor. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=50" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 50</bibl> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">et uls et cis Tiberim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 5:section=83" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 5, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinqueviri constituti sunt cis Tiberim et uls Tiberim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:13:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 13, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ulter: <entryFree id="n49656" type="gloss" key="ulter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ulter</orth>, <itype>tra, trum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (<sense id="n49656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> ulterior, us; <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> ultimus) [cf.: uls, ollus, olim; and the <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> ultra, ultro], prop. <hi rend="ital">that is beyond</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on the other side.</hi> The <hi rend="ital">posit.</hi> is not found, but the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> are very freq. </sense><sense id="n49656.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ultĕrĭor</orth>, <itype>ĭus</itype>, <hi rend="ital">farther</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the farther side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ulterior</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis est ulterior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum alter ulteriorem Galliam decernit cum Syriā, alter citeriorem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>transalpine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hispania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 314</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:107:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 107, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulterius medio spatium sol altus habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 417</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49656.2" n="B" level="2"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49656.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ul-tĕrĭōres</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. homines), <hi rend="ital">the more remote</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">more distant</hi> persons, <hi rend="ital">those beyond</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ab proximis impetrare non possent, ulteriores tentant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: recurritur ex proximis locis; <cit><quote lang="la">ulteriores non inventi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:60:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 60, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximi ripae neglegenter, ulteriores exquisitius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 17</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49656.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ultĕrĭōra</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. loca or negotia). </sense><sense id="n49656.5" n="(a)" level="5"> Of places, <hi rend="ital">the more remote parts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">regions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the districts beyond</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mosellae pons, qui ulteriora coloniae annectit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 77</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49656.6" n="(b)" level="5"> In gen., of things, <hi rend="ital">that which is beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">things beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farther</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">in addition; things future</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulteriora mirari, praesentia sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut dum proxima dicimus, struere ulteriora possimus,</quote> <trans><tr>things beyond</tr>, <tr>what is to come</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pudor est ulteriora loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:532" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 532</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:769" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 769</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper et inventis ulteriora petit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 9, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49656.7" n="3" level="3"> Rarely <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ultĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">something more</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any thing further</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (fero, tuli) praeteritum perfectum et ulterius non invenitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49656.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ultĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um, that is farthest beyond</itype>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the farthest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most distant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most remote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the uttermost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extreme</hi>, <hi rend="ital">last;</hi> often to be rendered as a <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the farthest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">most distant part of any thing</hi>, etc. (opp. to citimus, while extremus is opp. to intimus). </sense><sense id="n49656.9" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of space: <cit><quote lang="la">illa minima (luna) quae ultima a caeio, citima terris luce lucebat alienā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:16:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 16, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 20, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ultimam provinciam se conjecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">devehendum in ultimas maris terrarumque oras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 37, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hesperia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 36, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Geloni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in plateā ultimā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ultimis aedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spelunca draconis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauda,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the end of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 5, 4, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors ultima linea rerum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49656.10" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n49656.11" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ultĭmi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. homines), <hi rend="ital">the farthest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">most remote</hi> people: <cit><quote lang="la">recessum primis ultimi non dabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49656.12" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ultĭma</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. negotia), <hi rend="ital">the farthest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">most remote things</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeponens ultima primis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultima signant,</quote> <trans><tr>the goal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 317</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49656.13" n="(g)" level="5"> Rarely <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ultĭmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the end</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum ipsum, quod extremum atque ultimum mundi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:43:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 43, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49656.14" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49656.15" n="1" level="3"> Of time or order of succession, <hi rend="ital">the remotest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earliest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oldest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first; the last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">latest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">final</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultimi et proximi temporis recordatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:18:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 18, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam multis ab ultimā antiquitate repetitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 3</bibl></cit>. 8: <cit><quote lang="la">initium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria pueritiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria saeculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:16:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetustas hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultima quid referam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 109</bibl></cit>: scilicet ultima semper Exspectanda dies homini est, <hi rend="ital">last</hi>, id .M. 3, 135: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas est de ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:499" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 499</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:126" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a gravestone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:17:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 17, 20</bibl></cit>: cerae, i. e. <cb n="ULTI" /> <hi rend="ital">a last will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">testament</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:70:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 70, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:4:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtute pares, necessitate, quae ultimum ac maximum telum est, superiores estis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 28, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decurritur ad illud extremum atque ultimum senatus consultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5</bibl></cit>. —As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ultĭma</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">perferto et ultima exspectato,</quote> <trans><tr>final events</tr>, <tr>the end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultima vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:3:91" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 3, 91</bibl></cit>.—Rarely <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrem ultimo aetatis affectam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Vict. Or. Gent. Rom. 10</bibl></cit>.—Adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">si fidem ad ultimum fratri praestitisset,</quote> <trans><tr>to the last</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:19:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 19, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:64:8" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 64, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:64:11" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 64, 11</bibl>; also (more freq.) <hi rend="ital">at last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lastly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finally</hi>, = ad extremum, ad postremum, postremo: <cit><quote lang="la">si qualis in cives, talis ad ultimum in liberos esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 53, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 10, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne se ad ultimum perditum irent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 27, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ultimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 20, 139</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, ultimum,</quote> <trans><tr>for the last time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 29, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:12:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 12, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 126</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49656.16" n="2" level="3"> Of degree or rank, and denoting the highest as well as the lowest extreme of either. </sense><sense id="n49656.17" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The utmost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extreme</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the highest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greatest</hi>, = summus, extremus: <cit><quote lang="la">summum bonum, quod ultimum appello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:9:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultimae perfectaeque naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:12:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut absit ab ultimis vitiis ipse praeceptor ac schola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultimae causae cur perirent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:12:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex ad ultimum periculum venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:8:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:13" default="NO">6, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:9:11" default="NO">6, 9, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:12:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 12, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:43:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 43, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:12:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 12, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ultimam inopiam adducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 31, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ultimos casus servari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsecrationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:2:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: ultimum supplicium, <hi rend="ital">extreme</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">capital</hi>) <hi rend="ital">punishment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 84</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">poena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 58, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">desperatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:8:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:66:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 66, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:29:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 29, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">discrimen ultimum vitae et regni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:53:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 53, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 21, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ultimam perductus tristitiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 24</bibl></cit>.—Esp., as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ultĭ-ma</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ultima pati,</quote> <trans><tr>every extremity</tr>, <tr>the worst</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:54:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 54, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultima pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 483</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultima audere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam ultima experirentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 28, 9</bibl></cit>.—Rarely <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene in ultimum gladiorum erupit impunitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:125:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 125, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ultimum inopiae adducere,</quote> <trans><tr>to the last degree</tr>.</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 19, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 38, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ultimum periculi pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in pecude, nisi quae vis obstitit, videmus naturam suo quodam itinere ad ultimum pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:13:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 13, 35</bibl></cit>.—Adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ultimum pro fide morituri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium sceleratum, sed non ad ultimum demens,</quote> <trans><tr>in the extreme</tr>, <tr>utterly</tr>, <tr>to the last degree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 28, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49656.18" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The lowest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meanest</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">qui se Philippum regiaeque stirpis ferebat, cum esset ultimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:11:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principibus placuisse viris non ultima laus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 35</bibl></cit>: ultima sit laudes inter ut illa tuas, Auct. Cons. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultima pistoris illa uxor,</quote> <trans><tr>the worst</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 224, 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vigiliis et labore cum ultimis militum certaret (consul),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ultimis laudum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ultimis ponere,</quote> <trans><tr>the lowest</tr>, <tr>meanest things</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 12, 18, § 91</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ulterior: <entryFree id="n49657" type="main" key="ulte^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ultĕrĭor</orth>, <itype>us</itype>, v. ulter, I.</entryFree>
ulterius: <entryFree id="n49658" type="main" key="ulte^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ultĕrĭus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ultra, I. D.</entryFree>
ultime: <entryFree id="n49659" type="main" key="ulti^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ultĭmē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ultra, I. E.</entryFree>
ultimo: <entryFree id="n49660" type="main" key="ulti^mo_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ultĭmō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ultimus, under ulter, II. B. 1. <sense id="n49660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49661" type="main" key="ulti^mo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ultĭmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>ultimus</etym>, <sense id="n49661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to come to an end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be at the last</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ultimarent tempora patriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
ultimum: <entryFree id="n49662" type="main" key="ulti^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ultĭmum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ultimus, under ulter, II. B. 1. <sense id="n49662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ultimus: <entryFree id="n49663" type="main" key="ulti^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ultĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. ulter, II.</entryFree>
ultio: <entryFree id="n49664" type="main" key="ulti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ultĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ulciscor</etym>, <sense id="n49664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taking vengeance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avenging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revenge</hi> (not ante-Aug.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vindicta): quamquam serum auxilium perditis erat, tamen ultionem petens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultionem violatae per vim pudicitiae confessa viro est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 24, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhumanum verbum est et quidem pro isto receptum, ultio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:32:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas ultionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:32:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 32, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:3:3:3" default="NO">3, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:3:4:4" default="NO">3, 4, 4</bibl>; 3, 5, 8; 3, 27, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:27:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Clem. 1, 27, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:1:27:2" default="NO">1, 27, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 25</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:2" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:191 al" default="NO">191 al.</bibl>—Personified as a deity: <cit><quote lang="la">aram Ultioni statuendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 18</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of the passion, <hi rend="ital">indulgence</hi>: si ultio irae haec et <pb n="1926" /> <cb n="ULTR" /> non occasio cupiditatis explendae esset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 30, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ultor: <entryFree id="n49665" type="main" key="ultor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ultor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ulciscor</etym>, <sense id="n49665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a punisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avenger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revenger.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49665.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">conjurationis investigator atque ultor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:30:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 30, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Publius nostrarum injuriarum ultor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:77:268" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 77, 268</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 10, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exoriare aliquis nostris ex ossibus ultor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 625</bibl></cit>.—Attributively, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:340" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 340</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus ultor = Anteros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 750</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultores dii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultore ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:18:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultores ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:1:115" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 1, 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:495" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 495</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49665.2" n="II" level="1"> Ultor, a surname of Mars, <hi rend="ital">the Avenger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:577" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 577</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 121, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">232</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; 317, 8.</sense></entryFree>
ultorius: <entryFree id="n49666" type="main" key="ulto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ultōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ultor</etym>, <sense id="n49666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to vengeance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avenging</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ultra: <entryFree id="n49667" type="main" key="ultra_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ultrā</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos> <etym>ulter</etym>. <sense id="n49667.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49667.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">on the other side</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextera nec citra mota nec ultra,</quote> <trans><tr>neither on that side nor on this</tr>, <tr>neither backwards nor forwards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 186</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49667.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farther</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides;</hi> of space (rare): ultra procedendi facultas, Auct. B. Afr. 50, 3.—</sense><sense id="n49667.3" n="2" level="3"> Of time, degree, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">estne aliquid ultra, quo progredi crudelitas possit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:45:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 45, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid ultra requiratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nihil possit ultra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 1</bibl></cit>, B, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">quia ultra nihil habemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius ultra quam citra stat oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:9" default="NO">3, 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ultra Provehor?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam nihil ultra exspectantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 59</bibl>: eam (mortem) cuncta mortalium mala dissolvere; <cit><quote lang="la">ultra neque curae neque gaudio locum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac tempestate serviundum aut imperandum ... nam quid ultra? id. Or. Lepid. contra Sull. 5: nullum ultra periculum vererentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:39" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B.
