G. 8, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos alios muros, quae jam ultra moenia habetis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:782" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 782</bibl></cit>.—Of time: <cit><quote lang="la">usque ad Attium et ultra porrectas syllabas geminis vocalibus scripserunt,</quote> <trans><tr>farther</tr>, <tr>later</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ultra bellum Latinum dilatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 19, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49667.4" n="C" level="2"> Esp., on account of its comparative sense, freq. followed by <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra enim quo progrediar, quam ut veri videam similia, non habeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:9:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra quam homini datum est provehi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">10: ultra quam satis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:49:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 49, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 18, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 7, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra quam oporteat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>. 7; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 5, 24: ultra quam ullus spiritus durare possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 30, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ultra moratus, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49667.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ultĕrĭus</orth>, in the signif. of the <hi rend="ital">posit.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farther on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farther</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; in prose rare and only postAug.). </sense><sense id="n49667.6" n="(a)" level="5"> = ultra, cum quo Riphaeos possim conscendere montes Ulteriusque domo vadere Memnoniā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:6:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:872" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 872</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulterius nihil est, nisi non habitabile frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49667.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, = longius or amplius; <cit><quote lang="la">procedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulterius ne tende odiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:938" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 938</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si me ulterius provexerit ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 15</bibl></cit> (3, 7), 19: <cit><quote lang="la">revocavit me cogitationi aptae traditum, et iturum, si licuisset, ulterius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 102:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 102, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robur ulterius adversus eam saeviendi gentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:15" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ulterius dare corpus inutile leto Aut vacat aut curat,</quote> <trans><tr>farther</tr>, <tr>longer</tr>, <tr>more</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tulit ulterius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:487" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 487</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogabat Ulterius justo,</quote> <trans><tr>beyond what was right</tr>, <tr>more than was right</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:470" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 470</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49667.8" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ultĭmē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n49667.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Extremely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to the last degree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudam flagris ultime verberat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 250, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl></cit>, p. 105, 22.—</sense><sense id="n49667.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">At last</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 22</bibl> (dub.; al. ultimum).</sense><sense id="n49667.11" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi> with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">on the farther side of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">past</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cis Padum ultraque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra Silianam villam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milibus passuum II. ultra eum (montem) castra fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra Terminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra paulum prolata ultra sinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:159" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 159</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">118.— Placed after the noun: sunt certi denique fines, Quos ultra citraque nequit consistere rectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portas ultra procedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 29: <cit><quote lang="la">Euphratem ultra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n49667.12" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49667.13" n="(a)" level="5"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">past</hi>, <hi rend="ital">longer than</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Gorgias) et illorum fuit aemulus ut ultra Socratem usque duravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non durat ultra poenam abdicationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 88</bibl></cit>: ultra <cb n="ULTR" /> rudes annos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra pueriles annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49667.14" n="(b)" level="5"> Of number, measure, degree, quality, etc., <hi rend="ital">beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more than</hi>, = supra: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo ultra eum numerum, Auct. B. Alex. 21: non ultra heminam aquae assumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhibent modum quendam, quem ultra progredi non oporteat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:90" default="NO">11, 1, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est ultra pignus aut multam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: ultra Romanorum et mortalium etiam morem aliquem curare, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis ultra barbarum, promptus ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:118:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 118, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maecenas otio ac mollitiis paene ultra feminam fluens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:88:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 88, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mortalis ultra Fas trepidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra Legem tendere opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires ultra sortemque senectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ultra placitum laudarit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 7, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ultramundanus: <entryFree id="n49668" type="main" key="ultra_munda_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ultrā-mundānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n49668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is beyond the world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ultra - mundane</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">ille deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 185</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ultrix: <entryFree id="n49669" type="main" key="ultrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ultrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ultor</etym>, <sense id="n49669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">avenging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vengeful.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49669.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): ultricesque sedent in limine Dirae, <hi rend="ital">the avenging goddesses</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Furies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 473</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Furiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Ep. 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 967" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 967</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 895" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 895</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 98</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultricia bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:423" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela ultricia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:911" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 911</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n49669.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">she that avenges</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an avenger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultrix afflictae civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:43:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 43, 112</bibl></cit> (dub.; B. and K. victrix).</sense></entryFree>
ultro: <entryFree id="n49670" type="main" key="ultro_^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ultrō^</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n49670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to the farther side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the other side.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49670.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, so most usually in the connection ultro citroque, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:9:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 7, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 5, 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Hisp. 21: ultro et citro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 22, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultro ac citro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">or, without a copula, ultro citro,</quote> <trans><tr>on this side and on that</tr>, <tr>this way and that</tr>, <tr>to and fro</tr>, <tr>on both sides</tr>, <tr>mutually</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:33:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 33, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2:29" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 211</bibl>; v. citro; and cf. Hand, Turs. II. p. 87 sqq.—</sense><sense id="n49670.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49670.3" n="A" level="2"> Of distance, <hi rend="ital">afar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">off</hi> (so only in Plautus): <hi rend="ital">Ty.</hi> Proin' tu ab istoc procul recedas. <hi rend="ital">He.</hi> Ultro istum a me! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 19</bibl> Brix ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ultro istunc, qui exossat homines!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultro te amator apage te a dorso meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49670.4" n="B" level="2"> To denote that which is or is done over and above something else, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moreover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">too</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et mulier ut sit libera, atque ipse ultro det argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celavit suos cives ultroque eis sumptum intulit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 19, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavendo, ne metuant homines, metuendos ultro se efficiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:65:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 65, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sex. Naevius, qui, cum ipse ultro deberet, cupidissime contenderet, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 23, 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non debui tibi pecuniam ... ultro a me mutuatus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:107" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:7" default="NO">12, 8, 7</bibl> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his lacrimis vitam damus et miserescimus ultro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ultro ad cineres ipsius Adsumus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 55</bibl></cit> Forbig. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ultro animos tollit dictis atque increpat ultro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 127</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49670.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">superfluously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gratuitously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wantonly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ita putant, Sibi fieri injuriam ultro si quam fecere ipsi expostules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi ultro per contumelias hostem insultare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:62:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 62, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49670.6" n="C" level="2"> From beyond, from the other side, i. e. without influence or assistance from this side (cf. sponte, whose opposite is external compulsion or aid: ultro facio, non rogatus; sponte facio, non coactus neque adjutus; hence, ultro is esp. freq. with verbs of giving, offering, proposing, approaching, assailing, etc.), <hi rend="ital">on his part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on their part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of themselves</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">of one's own accord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without being asked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spontaneously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voluntarily: Gn.</hi> Jam haec tibi aderit supplicans Ultro. <hi rend="ital">Thr.</hi> Credin'? <hi rend="ital">Gn.</hi> Immo certe. Novi ingenium mulierum: <cit><quote lang="la">Nolunt, ubi velis: ubi nolis, cupiunt ultro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:42 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 42 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">O audaciam! etiam me ultro accusatum advenit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstrum etiam ultro derisum advenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui quoniam Erus quod imperavit neglexisti persequi, nunc venis etiam ultro inrisum dominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut homines Galli spem imperii ultro sibi a patriciis hominibus oblatam neglegerent, id non divinitus factum esse putatis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: ultro aliquid offerre,<cb n="ULUL" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 10, 26</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">offerendum ultro rati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offerentibus ultro sese militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum id, quod antea petenti denegasset, ultro polliceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: omnia ei ultro pollicitus sum, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mihi quicquam tali tempore in mentem venit optare, quod non ultro mihi Caesar detulerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has (tabulas) donavit his ultro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:111" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subinvideo tibi, ultro te etiam arcessitum ab eo,</quote> <trans><tr>of his own motion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultroque animam sub fasce dedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod divom promittere nemo Auderet, volvenda dies, en, attulit ultro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultro ad terram concidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 446</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultro ad me venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:172" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 172</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem ultro venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:18:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 18, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod occurrit ultro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogantibus libenter respondeat, non interrogantes percontetur ultro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: quemadmodum impetum occupemus facere ultro in regem, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 355, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum rex ab Attalo et Rhodiis ultro se bello lacessitum diceret, num Abydeni quoque, inquit, ultro tibi intulerunt arma?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 18, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 17, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 13, 2: ne collegae auxilium, quod acciendum ultro fuerit, suā sponte oblatum sperneretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 19, 1</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cappadocem illum non modo recipiebat (Asia) suis urbibus, verum etiam ultro vocabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 18, 61</bibl></cit>.—So, ultro tributa (and sometimes written as one word, ultrotributa), <hi rend="ital">expenditures made by the State for public works</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 11</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 44, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 16, 2</bibl> and 7.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus saepius in ultro tributis est,</quote> <trans><tr>gives rather than receives</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ultroneitas: <entryFree id="n49671" type="hapax" key="ultro_ne^i^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ultrōnĕĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ultroneus</etym>, <sense id="n49671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">freewill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voluntariness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultroneitas, quam libertatem arbitrii dicimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
ultroneus: <entryFree id="n49672" type="main" key="ultro_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ultrōnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ultro</etym>, <sense id="n49672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of one's own accord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voluntary</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">exsilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 111, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultroneam te dominae tuae reddis (i. e. ultro, tuā sponte),</quote> <trans><tr>voluntarily</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl></cit>, p. 175, 17; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 2, p. 350, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 25, 2</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:59:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 59, 8</bibl>, the correct read. is nati).</sense></entryFree>
ultrorsum: <entryFree id="n49673" type="hapax" key="ultrorsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ultrorsum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contr. from ultroversum</etym>, <sense id="n49673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">farther onwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pergere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Hist. Sacr. 2, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ultrotributa: <entryFree id="n49674" type="main" key="ultro_tri^bu_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ultrōtrĭbūta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. ultro <sense id="n49674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ultus: <entryFree id="n49675" type="main" key="ultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of ulciscor.</entryFree>
ulubrae: <entryFree id="n49676" type="main" key="U^lu_^brae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŭlū^brae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n49676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small town of Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by the Pontine Marshes</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Cisterna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:102" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 102</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 121 sq.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n49676.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŭlū^brānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Ulubrœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ulubran</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <trans><tr>the inhabitants of Ulubrœ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49676.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŭlū^brenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Ulubrœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Ulubrans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ulucus: <entryFree id="n49677" type="hapax" key="ulucus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ulucus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a screech-owl</hi>, = ulula, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 8, 55</bibl> (al. alucos).</sense></entryFree>
ulula: <entryFree id="n49678" type="main" key="u^lu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭlŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. avis) [kindr. with Sanscr. ulūka; old Germ. uwila, ūla; new Germ. Eule; Engl. owl; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)lolu/zw</foreign>], <sense id="n49678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a screechowl</hi> whose cry was of ill omen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:11:section=75" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 11, § 75</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 12, 16, § 34</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 13, 39, § 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 55</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">homines eum pejus formidant quam fullo ululam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Sat. Men. 86:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Sat. Men. 86, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ululabilis: <entryFree id="n49679" type="main" key="u^lu^la_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭlŭlābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ululo, the shrieker</etym>, <sense id="n49679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">howling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wailing</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">plangor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 143, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, p. 161, 40: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>, p. 240, 28; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ululamen: <entryFree id="n49680" type="hapax" key="u^lu^la_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭlŭlāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a howling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wailing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">howl</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 10, 122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ululatio: <entryFree id="n49681" type="gloss" key="u^lu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭlŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a howling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wailing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lamentation</hi> over a deceased person, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 705, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ululatus: <entryFree id="n49682" type="main" key="u^lu^la_tu^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭlŭlātŭs</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a howling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wailing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrieking</hi>, as a sound of mourning or lamentation, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:667" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 667</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 179</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 153</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 447</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 145</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lugubris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:12:12" default="NO">5, 12, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:178 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 178 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">The wild yells</hi> or <hi rend="ital">warwhoops</hi> of the Gauls, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 80</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">The wild cries and shouts</hi> of the Bacchanals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 528</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 706</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ululo: <entryFree id="n49683" type="main" key="u^lu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭlŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n49683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [ulula; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(la/w</foreign>]. </sense><sense id="n49683.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to howl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shriek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utter a mournful cry.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49683.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis ululat acute, Enn. ap. Fest. s. v. nictare, p. 177 Müll. (Ann. v. 346 Vahl. : canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 257</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:797" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 797</bibl> lupi, <pb n="1927" /> <cb n="UMBO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 486</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 18</bibl>: simulacra ferarum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 404</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summoque ulularunt vertice Nymphae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 168</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tisiphone thalamis ululavit in illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per vias ululasse animas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:553" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 553</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 725</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 642</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:261 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 261 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ululanti voce canere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 8, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49683.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of places, <hi rend="ital">to ring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">re-echo</hi> with howling: <cit><quote lang="la">penitusque cavae plangoribus aedes Femineis ululant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resonae ripae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:285" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dindyma sanguineis Gallis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 269</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49683.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">howl out to</hi> any one; <hi rend="ital">to howl forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utter with howlings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cry out; to wail</hi> or <hi rend="ital">howl over</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to fill</hi> a place <hi rend="ital">with howling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with yells</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shrieks</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>, and mostly in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quem sectus ululat Gallus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:41:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnisque Hecate triviis ululata per urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 609</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ululata Lucina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:158" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbatam propriis ululavit civibus urbem,</quote> <trans><tr>wailed over</tr>, <tr>bewailed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ululataque tellus intremit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:608" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 608</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga lupis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:85" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antra Ogygiis furoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:328" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 1, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aula puerperiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 139</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tu dulces lituos ululataque proelia gaudes,</quote> <trans><tr>filled with howling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:724" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 724</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ulurtini: <entryFree id="n49684" type="main" key="Ulurti_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ulurtīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Lower Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ulva: <entryFree id="n49685" type="main" key="ulva"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ulva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root or-, ol-; cf. origo</etym>, <sense id="n49685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sedge</hi>: Ulva conferva, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 1, 1, § 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:209" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 23, 35, § 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:111" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 17, 68, § 111</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 37, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:13:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 175</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 8, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 299</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 345</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 336</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ulvosus: <entryFree id="n49686" type="main" key="ulvo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ulvōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ulva</etym>, <sense id="n49686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in sedge</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carm. 7, 324</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ulysses: <entryFree id="n49687" type="main" key="U^lysses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŭlysses</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. Ulixes.</entryFree>
umbella: <entryFree id="n49688" type="main" key="umbella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">umbella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>umbra</etym> (a little shadow, i. e. meton.), <sense id="n49688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sunshade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parasol</hi>, <hi rend="ital">umbrella</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:28" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 28</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> 11, 73, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:50" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
umber: <entryFree id="n49689" type="main" key="Umber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Umber</orth>, <itype>bra, brum</itype>, v. Umbri, A.</entryFree>
umbilicaris: <entryFree id="n49690" type="hapax" key="umbi^li_ca_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">umbĭlīcāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>umbilicus</etym>, <sense id="n49690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the navel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">umbilical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervus,</quote> <trans><tr>the navel-string</tr>, <tr>umbilical cord</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Chr. 20 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
umbilicatus: <entryFree id="n49691" type="hapax" key="umbi^li_ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">umbĭlīcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">navel-shaped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">umbilicate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alvo mediā plerisque umbilicatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
umbilicus: <entryFree id="n49692" type="main" key="umbi^li_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">umbĭlīcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>akin to <foreign lang="greek">o)mfalo/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n49692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the navel.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49692.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 89, § 220</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 45, 8</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 85, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 11, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49692.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49692.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The umbilical cord</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:29:section=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 29, § 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49692.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The middle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">centre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies quidem jam ad umbilicum est dimidiatus mortuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui locus, quod in mediā est insulā situs, umbilicus Siciliae nominatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 106</bibl></cit>: terrarum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Delphi</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 17</bibl> Müll.; and in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:56:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 56, 115</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called umbilicus orbis terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 48, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, umbilicus medius Graeciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:23:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 23, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Aetoli) umbilicum Graeciae incolerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: Italiae, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 100</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49692.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The projecting end of the cylinder on which an ancient book was rolled</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:6:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:67:11" default="NO">1, 67, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:2:9" default="NO">3, 2, 9</bibl>; 5, 6, 15; 8, 61, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 22, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iambos ad umbilicum adducere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to bring to a close</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:8" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 14, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ohe, jam satis est, ohe libelle: Jam pervenimus usque ad umbilicos,</quote> <trans><tr>to the end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:91:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 91, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49692.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A projection in the middle of plants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 22, 24, § 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:29" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 7, 10, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:136" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 14, 36, § 136</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 7, 8</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n49692.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A small circle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 20, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:327" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 33, 76, § 327</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49692.8" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The pin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">index on a sundial</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 34, 39, § 212</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:182" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 72, 74, § 182</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49692.9" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of sea-snail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sea-cockle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 6, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:8:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vit. Caes. 3" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vit. Caes. 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49692.10" n="H" level="1"> Umbilicus Veneris, <hi rend="ital">the herb navelwort</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
umbo: <entryFree id="n49693" type="main" key="umbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">umbo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">a)/mbwn, o)mfalo/s</foreign>, umbilicus; Germ. Nabel; Engl. navel</etym>; prop. any convex elevation; hence, <sense id="n49693.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A boss</hi> of a shield, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 432 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:546" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 546</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutis magis quam gladiis geritur res: umbonibus incussāque alā sternuntur hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 41, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49693.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a shield</hi> (in prose not ante-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. clipeus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:633" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 633</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 810</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 884</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:354" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 354</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 19, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 34, 3</bibl>; Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">junctae umbone phalanges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:46" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 192</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbone se protegere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 33, 2</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicialis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:5:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49693.2" n="II" level="1"> <cb n="UMBR" /> <hi rend="ital">The elbow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:46:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 46, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:670" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 670</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 68 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n49693.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A promontory</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 408</bibl>.—Hence, transf., Isthmius, <hi rend="ital">the Isthmus of Corinth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:15" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 15</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n49693.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A projecting boundary-stone</hi> in fields, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:352" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 352</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49693.5" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A projecting part</hi> of a precious stone, <hi rend="ital">a knob</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boss</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 23, § 88</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49693.6" n="VI" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The full part</hi> or <hi rend="ital">swelling</hi> of a garment, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 5</bibl>.—Hence, transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">umbo candidus,</quote> <trans><tr>a toga</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:33" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
umbra: <entryFree id="n49694" type="main" key="umbra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">umbra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; Curt. compares Sanscr. ambara, an encircling</etym>, <sense id="n49694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shadow.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49694.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum usque quaque umbra est, tamen Sol semper hic est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa platanus, cujus umbram secutus est Socrates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fiebat, ut incideret luna in eam metam, quae esset umbra terrae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles ... afferunt umbram vallibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox Involvens umbrā magnā terramque polumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spissis noctis se condidit umbris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 621</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majoresque cadunt altis de montibus umbrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 1, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pampineae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum est mihi, quasi umbra, quoquo ibis tu, te persequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 82</bibl>.—Prov.: umbras timere, <hi rend="ital">to be afraid of shadows</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to fear without cause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 20, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbram suam metuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse meas solus, quod nil est, aemulor umbras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34</bibl></cit> (3, 32), 19.—</sense><sense id="n49694.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49694.3" n="1" level="3"> In painting, <hi rend="ital">the dark part</hi> of a painting, <hi rend="ital">shade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shadow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam multa vident pictores in umbris et in eminentiā, quae nos non videmus!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>; so (opp. lumen) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 5, 11, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:131" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 11, 40, § 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:163" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 3, 57, § 163</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49694.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A shade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ghost</hi> of a dead person (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Manes, Lemures): nos ubi decidimus, Quo dives Tullus et Ancus, Pulvis et umbra sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne forte animas Acherunte reamur Effugere aut umbras inter vivos volitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cornea (porta), quā veris facilis datur exitus umbris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:894" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 894</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 734</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 8, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 2, 6, § 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:59 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 59 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Umbrarum rex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pluto</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 249</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dominus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 16</bibl></cit>.— In the <number>plur.</number> umbrae, of a single dead person: <cit><quote lang="la">matris agitabitur umbris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 410</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 476</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 541</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 510</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 519 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n49694.5" n="3" level="3"> Like the Greek <foreign lang="greek">skia/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an uninvited guest</hi>, whom an invited one brings with him (cf. parasitus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 27</bibl>; so, of an <hi rend="ital">attendant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49694.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A shade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shady place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that which gives a shade</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shadow</hi> (as a tree, house, tent, etc; <usg type="style">poet.</usg>); <cit><quote lang="la">of trees: nudus Arboris Othrys erat nec habebat Pelion umbras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 513</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 88</bibl>; 10, 90; 14, 447; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 157</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 9, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:681" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 681</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeiā spatiabere cultus in umbrā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in the Pompeian portico</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 75; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 387</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuā tonsoris in umbrā,</quote> <trans><tr>in the cool barber's shop</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia in umbrā educata,</quote> <trans><tr>in the closet</tr>, <tr>study</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetorica,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the rhetorician's school</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:173" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum roseis venit umbra genis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>down</tr>, <tr>beard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:336" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 336</bibl></cit>; cf.: dubia lanuginis, Claud. Nupt. Pall. et Celer. 42: nunc umbra nudata sua jam tempora moerent, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of hair</hi>, Petr. poët. 109: summae cassidis umbra, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the plume</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:226" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 226</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed non erat illi Arcus et ex umeris nullae fulgentibus umbrae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>quivers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 3, 4, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49694.7" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> sciaena; <hi rend="ital">a grayling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">umber</hi>: Salmo thymallus, Linn.; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 299</bibl> (Heduph. v. 7 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=77" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 77</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:111" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 90</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49694.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, like the Engl. <hi rend="ital">shadow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shade.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49694.9" n="A" level="2"> Opp. to substance or reality, <hi rend="ital">a trace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure sign</hi> or <hi rend="ital">image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faint appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperfect copy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">representation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">semblance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretence</hi> (cf. simulacrum): <cit><quote lang="la">veri juris germanaeque justitiae solidam et expressam effigiem nullam tenemus, umbrā et imaginibus utimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 17, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra et imago civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:30:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 30, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra et imago equitis Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 15, 41</bibl></cit>: o hominem amentem et miserum, qui ne umbram quidem umquam <foreign lang="greek">tou= kalou=</foreign> viderit! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo ipsam luxuriam reperire non potes, in eo te umbram luxuriae reperturum putas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: in comoediā maxime claudicamus ... vix levem<cb n="UMBR" />  consequimur umbram, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:100" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub umbrā foederis aequi servitutem pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbras falsae gloriae consectari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:24:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 24, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra es amantum magis quam amator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendax pietatis umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 459</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:316" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbras quasdam veritatis habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 2, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 273</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49694.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Shelter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra et recessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrā magni nominis delitescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra vestri auxilii tegi possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 30, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub umbrā auxilii vestri latere volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:21:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 21, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub umbrā Romanae amicitiae latebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum vitia sub umbrā eloquentiae primo latebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49694.11" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leisure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignavā Veneris cessamus in umbrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 18, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:Ob. Maec. 98" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> Ob. Maec. 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
umbraculum: <entryFree id="n49695" type="main" key="umbra_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">umbrācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>umbra</etym> (<sense id="n49695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">any thing that furnishes shade</hi>). </sense><sense id="n49695.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a shady place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arbor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:51:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 51, 2</bibl>; Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49695.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a school</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in solem et pulverem, ut e Theophrasti doctissimi hominis umbraculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 9, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex umbraculis eruditorum in solem atque in pulverem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:6:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 6, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49695.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sunshade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parasol</hi>, <hi rend="ital">umbrella</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:311" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 311</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:28:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 28, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:97" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 97</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 315, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
umbraliter: <entryFree id="n49696" type="hapax" key="umbra_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">umbrālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">figuratively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">metaphorically</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 37" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
umbraticola: <entryFree id="n49697" type="hapax" key="umbra_ti^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">umbrātĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>umbra-colo</etym>, <sense id="n49697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who is fond of the shade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an effeminate person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lounger</hi>, = umbraticus homo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
umbraticus: <entryFree id="n49698" type="main" key="umbra_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">umbrātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>umbra</etym>, <sense id="n49698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the shade</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to retirement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seclusion</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">leisure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who loves to stay in the shade</tr>, <tr>an idler</tr>, <tr>lounger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 3, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49698.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">retired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">private</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemplative</hi> (opp. forensis): <cit><quote lang="la">Epicureorum delicata et umbratica turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:2:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solitaria et velut umbratica vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (al. umbratili): <cit><quote lang="la">doctor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>one who teaches at home</tr>, <tr>a private tutor</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <trans><tr>composed in one's study</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium,</quote> <trans><tr>that is attended to at home</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:1:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
umbratilis: <entryFree id="n49699" type="main" key="umbra_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">umbrātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">remaining in the shade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in retirement</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">at home; private</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemplative.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49699.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vita umbratilis et delicata,</quote> <trans><tr>a dreamy life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:11:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mora segnis et umbratilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum inerti et umbratili milite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49699.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of speech, <hi rend="ital">in the manner of the schools</hi> (opp. to public, political): <cit><quote lang="la">educenda deinde dictio est ex hac domesticā exercitatione et umbratili medium in agmen, in pulverem: in clamorem, in castra atque in aciem forensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollis est oratio philosophorum et umbratilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:19:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 19, 64</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">umbrātĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in outline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slightly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">effingimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
umbratio: <entryFree id="n49700" type="main" key="umbra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">umbrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>umbro</etym>, <sense id="n49700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shadowing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequebatur columna nubis quasi umbratio Spiritus Sancti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Sacr. 1, 6, § 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
umbrenus: <entryFree id="n49701" type="main" key="Umbre_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Umbrēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Publius, <sense id="n49701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellowconspirator with Catiline</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 40, 1</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
umbresco: <entryFree id="n49702" type="main" key="umbresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">umbresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n49702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [umbra], <hi rend="ital">to shadow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become shadowy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">darken</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Compl. Apoc. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
umbri: <entryFree id="n49703" type="main" key="Umbri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Umbri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the district of Umbria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which was named after them</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:112" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 14, 19, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 37</bibl> sq.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n49703.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Umber</orth>, <itype>bra, brum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Umbrians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Umbrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:39:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 39, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">villicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:31:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 31, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 303</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49703.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Umber</orth>, <itype>bri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. canis), <hi rend="ital">an Umbrian dog</hi> used in hunting, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:753" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 753</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 497" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 497</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:420" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 420</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:295" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 295</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 171 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">A kind of sheep in Spain and Corsica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 49, 75, § 199</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49703.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Umbra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female Umbrian</hi>, in a pun with umbra, a shadow, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49703.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Um-brĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a district of Italy so called</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:50:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 50, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:20:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 20, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:41:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 41, 92</bibl>.—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">Umbria terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49703.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Umbrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <pb n="1928" /> <cb n="UMEO" /> <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Umbria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Umbrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">creta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 17, 57, § 197</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
umbricius: <entryFree id="n49704" type="main" key="Umbrici^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Umbricĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a haruspex in the service of Otho</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
umbrifer: <entryFree id="n49705" type="main" key="umbri^fe^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">umbrĭfĕr</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>umbra-fero</etym>. <sense id="n49705.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Shade-bringing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shade-giving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">casting a shade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shady</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">platanus, Cic. poët. Div. 2. 30, 63: nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 473</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: Academia, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 13, 22.—</sense><sense id="n49705.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to umbra, I. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">Bearing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carrying the shades of the dead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:1:427" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 1, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:18" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
