umbro: <entryFree id="n49706" type="main" key="umbro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">umbro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>umbra</etym>, <sense id="n49706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shadow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overshadow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overspread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover; to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast a shade</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n49706.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(quercus) Umbrabat coma summi fastigia montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:488" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:2:36" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes oleā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to plant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:24" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carchedonios purpureos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 25, § 95</bibl></cit> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">al. obumbrante): matrem (i. e. tellurem) rosarum floribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:629" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 629</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49706.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora quercu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:772" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 772</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem umbrante capillo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:403" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux umbratus rosis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 444</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 164</bibl>.—In a Greek construction: <cit><quote lang="la">umbratus tempora ramis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:554" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 554</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbratus genas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>covered with a beard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 3, 4, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrata tempora galero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:137" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 137</bibl></cit>: umbrantur somno pupulae, <hi rend="ital">are shaded</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">covered</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 172, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">telis diem,</quote> <trans><tr>to darken</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 2, 122</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes paene virgae, ne umbrent, abraduntur,</quote> <trans><tr>cast a shade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:7:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
umbrosus: <entryFree id="n49707" type="main" key="umbro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">umbrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of shade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shady</hi>, <hi rend="ital">umbrageous</hi> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opacus): locus umbrosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fere aquosissima sunt quaecumque umbrosissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:11:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fico folium maximum umbrosissimumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 26, 49, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter densas, umbrosa cacumina, fagos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Silae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 693</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in umbrosis lucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orae Heliconis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arx Parnasi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 467</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:762" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 762</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:1" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 360</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">umbrōsa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the twilight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dim light</hi> (opp. tenebrae, clara lux), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
umectatio: <entryFree id="n49708" type="main" key="u_mecta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūmectātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hūmec-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>umecto</etym>, <sense id="n49708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a moistening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moisture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris nauseabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimica (agri),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 10, 26</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 4, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20, 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
umecto: <entryFree id="n49709" type="main" key="u_mecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūmecto</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">hū-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>umectus</etym>. <sense id="n49709.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to moisten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quā niger umectat flaventia culta Galaesus,</quote> <trans><tr>waters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et sacer umectat fluvialia rura Capenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:85" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statque umectata Vomano Adria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:439" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 439</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terras veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:210" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effigiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et lacrimis salsis umectent ora genasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:919" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 919</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 465</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 655</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum meus umectat flaventes Lucifer agros (rore),</quote> <trans><tr>bedews</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus (agni) os pressis umectare papillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 17</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mulier) tenet assuetis umectans oscula labris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1190</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49709.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, of the eyes, <hi rend="ital">to be moist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tearful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to weep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardent (oculi), intenduntur, umectant, conivent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 54, § 145</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 3, 3, § 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
umectus: <entryFree id="n49710" type="main" key="u_mectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūmectus</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">hū-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>umeo</etym>, <sense id="n49710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a moist nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">damp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet</hi> (ante- and post-class. for umidus): terra exhalat auram atque auroram umidam, umectam, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:4:9:section=24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 4, 9, § 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus umectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:24:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 24, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 634</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor vini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 14, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualitas caeli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 16, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventres umectiores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 15 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 47</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier umectissimo est corpore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
umefacio: <entryFree id="n49711" type="main" key="u_me^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūmĕ-făcĭo</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">hū-</orth>), no <sense id="n49711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>factum, ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>umeo-facio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make moist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to moisten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">de halitu terrae aut maris nebula exsistit, quae dispersa umefacit, quicquid texerit, Lact. de Ira Dei, 10: spongia crebro umefacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32</bibl></cit>. 10, 48, § 138.</sense></entryFree>
umeo: <entryFree id="n49712" type="main" key="u_me^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūmĕo</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">hū-</orth>), no <sense id="n49712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> nor <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <itype>ēre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>v. umor</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to be moist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">damp</hi>, <cb n="UMES" /> <hi rend="ital">wet</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.; most freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n49712.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Verb. finit.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calidā qui locus umet aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:146" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagnata paludibus ument,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ument genae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 8, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor lacrimis cadentibus umet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 509</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49712.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Part. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigida pugnabant calidis, umentia siccis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umentes terrae (Nilo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:30:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 30, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 604</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:763" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 763</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umentes spongias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umens caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:123" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:38" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 38</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 464</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi atque ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:30" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umentemque Aurora polo dimoverat umbram,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the cool night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:589" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 589</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umentis rores noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:469" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
umerale: <entryFree id="n49713" type="main" key="u^me^ra_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭmĕrāle</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">hŭ-</orth>; v. umerus), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>umerus, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n49713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering for the shoulders</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a</hi> (military) <hi rend="ital">cape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si miles tibiale vel umerale alienavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
umerulus: <entryFree id="n49714" type="main" key="u^me^ru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭmĕrŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little shoulder</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 7, 30</bibl>; 7, 34; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:41:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ezech. 41, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
umerus: <entryFree id="n49715" type="main" key="u^me^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭmĕrus</orth> (incorrectly spelled <orth extent="full" lang="la">hŭmĕ-rus</orth> in many edd.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">w)=mos</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n49715.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">the upper bone of the arm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n49715.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49715.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The upper part of the arm</hi> (so only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for the usual lacertus): <cit><quote lang="la">innixus dextro plena trahens umero,</quote> <trans><tr>upperarm</tr>, <tr>arm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:44" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeros exsertus uterque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:439" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 439</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 235</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:409" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 409</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49715.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The shoulder</hi> (of a man; opp. armus of an animal, v. h. v.; <cit><quote lang="la">the predom. signif. of the word): meus est ballista pugnus, cubitus catapulta est mihi, Umerus aries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id conexum in umero laevo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittae pendebant ab umero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:34:section=74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 34, § 74</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 21, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">umerum apertum gladio appetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chloris albo sic umero nitens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sparsum odoratis umerum capillis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 20, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars umeri ima tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 307</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(virgines) quas matres student Demissis umeris esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutum, gladium, galeam in onere nostri milites non plus numerant quam umeros, lacertos, manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut bracchia modo atque umeri ad sustinenda arma liberi ab aquā esse possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedites tantummodo umeris ac summo pectore exstare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Milo umeris sustineret bovem vivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod pupillum filium ipse paene in umeros suos extulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densum umeris vulgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nube candentes umeros amictus Augur Apollo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">candidi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeris positurus arcum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quae nunc umeris involitant, deciderint comae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 10, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex umeris armi fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 700</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:396" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 396</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terrestrium solus homo bipes: uni juguli, umeri, ceteris armi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 43, 98, § 243</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49715.4" n="2" level="3"> Umerus is also used of animals (as, on the other hand, armi is of men; v. armus); <cit><quote lang="la">of oxen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:159" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 159</bibl></cit>.—Of cocks, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49715.5" n="C" level="2"> Of <hi rend="ital">the middle part</hi> of a thing, <hi rend="ital">the back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ridge</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n49715.6" n="1" level="3"> Of trees and plants: <cit><quote lang="la">certum est ab umeris arborum surculos petendos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 3, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49715.7" n="2" level="3"> Of mountain ridges: <cit><quote lang="la">montium flexus crebrique vertices et conflexa cubito aut confracta in umeros juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 44, 44, § 115</bibl></cit> (al. numeros): <cit><quote lang="la">virides umeros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:714" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 714</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49715.8" n="3" level="3"> Of a country: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhegium oppidum in umero ejus (Italiae) situm, a quo veluti cervicis incipit flexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 43</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">duo haec oppida ... sita sunt utrāque ex parte velut in umeris Helladis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 7, 11, § 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49715.9" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the shoulders;</hi> as in Engl., when speaking of bearing a burden: <cit><quote lang="la">tota ut comitia suis, ut dictitabat, umeris sustineret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam umeris sustinere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 37, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum expertus esset, quam bene umeris tuis sederet imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:10:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 10, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:57:4" default="NO" valid="yes">57, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumite materiam vestris qui scribitis aequam Viribus, et versate diu, quid ferre recusent, Quid valeant umeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
umesco: <entryFree id="n49716" type="main" key="u_mesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūmesco</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">hū-</orth>), no <sense id="n49716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> nor <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, ĕre, 3, <hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [umeo], <hi rend="ital">to grow moist</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wet</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">(equi) umescunt spumis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cortex non umescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra umescens rore occulto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 34, 77, § 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Sept. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidimus umescentes oculos tuos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:73:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 73, 4</bibl></cit>. <cb n="UMQU" /></sense></entryFree>
umide: <entryFree id="n49717" type="main" key="u_mi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūmĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>umidus</etym>, <sense id="n49717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moistly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by reason of moisture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tigna umide putrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
umidulus: <entryFree id="n49718" type="main" key="u_mi^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūmĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n49718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">rather damp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dampish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wettish</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:629" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 629</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 106</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
umidus: <entryFree id="n49719" type="main" key="u_mi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūmĭdus</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">hū-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>umeo</etym>. <sense id="n49719.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">moist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">damp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">simplex est natura animantis, ut vel terrena sit vel ignea vel animalis vel umida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:14:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 14, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terrena et umida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:873" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 873</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem ex lignis viridibus atque umidis facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:16:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 16, § 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(naves) factae subito ex umidā materiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:948 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 948 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguaï templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 622</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:10" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto umidius est solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:19:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager uliginosus umidissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:5:9:section=44" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 5, 9, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umidissimum cerebrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 49, § 133</bibl></cit>: subices, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:17:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 17, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla dies adeo est australibus umida nimbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:4:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solstitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the river</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 363</bibl></cit>: caedunt securibus umida vina, i. e. <hi rend="ital">formerly liquid</hi> (now frozen), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 364</bibl> Heyn.: <cit><quote lang="la">caligo, quam circa umidi effuderant montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 594</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 486</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umidiora et aquosa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 9</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūmĭdum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. solum), <hi rend="ital">a moist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">damp place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra in umido locare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontes et aggeres umido paludum imponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba in umidis nascens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 63, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sirius alto Defluit ab caelo mersumque per umida quaerit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the ocean</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 755</bibl></cit>; cf. Cels. praef. 1.—</sense><sense id="n49719.1" n="II" level="1"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">watery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
umifer: <entryFree id="n49720" type="main" key="u_mi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūmĭ-fer</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">hū-</orth>), <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>umor-fero</etym>, <sense id="n49720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing moisture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moist</hi>: sucus, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 9, 15.</sense></entryFree>
umifico: <entryFree id="n49721" type="main" key="u_mi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūmĭfĭco</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">hū-</orth>), no <sense id="n49721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> nor <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>umificus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make moist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to moisten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sementem Notus umificet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 8, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
umi: <entryFree id="n49722" type="main" key="u_mi^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūmĭ-fĭcus</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">hū-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>umor-facio</etym>, <sense id="n49722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that renders moist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moistening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 100, 101, § 223</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
umor: <entryFree id="n49723" type="main" key="u_mor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūmor</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">hu-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root ug-, found in Sanscr. uksh-, to sprinkle; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(gro/s</foreign>; cf.: uva, uveo</etym>, <sense id="n49723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a liquid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fluid</hi> of any kind, <hi rend="ital">moisture</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">itaque et aquilonibus reliquisque frigoribus durescit umor et idem vicissim mollitur tepefactus et tabescit calore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin et umorem et calorem, qui est fusus in corpore, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera marinis terrenisque umoribus extenuatis aluntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et umor allapsus extrinsecus, ut in tectoriis videmus austro, sudorem videtur imitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:27:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 27, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nares umorem semper habent ad pulverem multaque alia depellenda non inutilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis concreti umores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ranarum et in terrā et in umore vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 31, 48, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquidus aquaï or aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 427</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:350 al" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 350 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluvius,</quote> <trans><tr>rain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 496</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:515" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 515</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">roscidus,</quote> <trans><tr>dew</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumfluus,</quote> <trans><tr>the ocean</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candens lacteus,</quote> <trans><tr>milk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 258</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lacteus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 358</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Massicus Bacchi,</quote> <trans><tr>wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 143</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcis musti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor et in genas Furtim labitur,</quote> <trans><tr>tears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caret os umore loquentis,</quote> <trans><tr>saliva</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 354</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">linguam defecerat umor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:567" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 567</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saccatus corporis,</quote> <trans><tr>urine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1028" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1028</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praefandi umoris, e corpore effluvium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 51, 52, § 171</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">lyncum umor ita redditus glaciatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 38, 57, § 137</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49723.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, comic.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego jam hic te itidem, quasi peniculus novus exurgeri solet, Ni hunc amittis, exurgebo, quicquid umoris tibi'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ego amoris aliquantum habeo umorisque meo etiam in corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
umorosus: <entryFree id="n49724" type="main" key="u_mo_ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūmōrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>umor</etym>, <sense id="n49724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet</hi> (post-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">for class. umidus): loca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
umquam: <entryFree id="n49725" type="main" key="umquam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">umquam</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">unquam</orth>), <sense id="n49725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv. temp.</hi> [etym dub.], <hi rend="ital">at any time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ever</hi> (opp. never; cf. aliquando); most freq. in neg. clauses, sometimes also in interrogations and in conditional clauses; but very seldom in affirmations.<pb n="1929" /> <cb n="UNAN" />  </sense><sense id="n49725.1" n="I" level="1"> In neg. clauses. </sense><sense id="n49725.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (principium) si numquam oritur, ne occidit quidem umquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:25:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 25, 27</bibl></cit>: quod nemo umquam homo antehac Vidit, Plant. Am. 2, 1, 16; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque umquam quicquam me juvat quod edo domi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam opinionem nemo umquam mortalis assequi potuit sine, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 10, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 15, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nec didicerint, nec uniquam scire curaverint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque haud sciam an ne opus sit quidem nihil umquam omnino deesse amicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 14, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo umquam adiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:17:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 17, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ita sim adflictus ut nemo umquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque quantus non umquam antea exercitus venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 37, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 39, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non umquam gravis aere domum mihi dextra redibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:6:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 6, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mehercule hoc umquam dixi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 74</bibl></cit>: utinam ne umquam Mede Colchis cupido corde pedem extulisses, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 297, 20</bibl> (Trag. v. 311 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n49725.3" n="2" level="3"> In clauses, affirmative in form, in which a negation is implied (cf. II. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">cave posthac, si me amas, umquam istuc verbum ex te audiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">raro umquam, nisi forte, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>hardly ever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">difficilior (interrogatio) hoc, quod raro umquam possunt ante judicium scire, quid testis dicturus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49725.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49725.5" n="1" level="3"> In interrogations implying a negative: <hi rend="ital">Le.</hi> Sed tu, en umquam cum quiquam viro Consuevisti? <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Nisi quidem cum Alcesimarcho nemine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 15</bibl>; so, en umquam, very freq.; v. en: <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> Eho an umquam tu hujus nupsisti patri? <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Di melius faciant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ullamne ego rem umquam in vita meā Volui, quin? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: dic mihi hoc; <cit><quote lang="la">solent tibi umquam oculi duri fieri?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 5, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis homo pro moecho umquam vidit in domo meretriciā Prendi quemquam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49725.6" n="2" level="3"> In conditional clauses; <cit><quote lang="la">si umquam in dicendo fuimus aliquid ... tum profecto, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Al.</hi> Di me perdant ... Si illam uxorem duxero mihi umquam, quam despondit pater. <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Et me, si umquam tibi uxorem filiam dedero meam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:31 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 31 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">date ergo, daturae Si umquam estis hodie uxorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te in plateā offendero hac post umquam, periisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 9</bibl></cit> (8), 34: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi si umquam filius erit, nae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si umquam ullum fuit tempus, mater, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vovisse hunc dicam, si salvos domum redisset umquam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando umquam equestri ope adjutam rempublicam meminerint, illo die annitantur, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 14, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49725.7" n="II" level="1"> In affirmative clauses (cf. I. A. 2. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">plus amat quam te umquam amavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 4, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 22</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 8, 71: ut minime mirum futurum sit, si (Isocrates) ... reliquis praestet omnibus, qui umquam orationes attigerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:13:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 13, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ei praeter spem acciderat, ut illam terram umquam attingeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: cum tyranno instituere amicitiam; <cit><quote lang="la">et tyranno quam, qui umquam fuit, saevissimo, Liv 24, 32, 3: quare nunc quoque, licet major quam umquam moles premat, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">2: utinam sit tempus umquam quo perfectus aliquis orator, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>for once</tr>, <tr>ever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excute: sic umquam longā relevere catenā, Nec tibi perpetuo serva bibatur aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scintillam e stellā cadere et augeri terrae appropinquantem ... semel umquam proditur, Cn. Octavio C. Scribonio coss.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 35, 35, § 100</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
una: <entryFree id="n49726" type="main" key="u_na_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnā</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. unus <sense id="n49726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
unaetvicesimani: <entryFree id="n49727" type="main" key="u_na^etvi_ce_si^ma_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnăetvīcēsĭmāni</orth>, v. unetvicesimani.</entryFree>
unaetvicesimus: <entryFree id="n49728" type="main" key="u_na^etvi_ce_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnăetvīcēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. unetvicesimus.</entryFree>
unanimans: <entryFree id="n49729" type="main" key="u_na^ni^mans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnănĭmans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unus-animus</etym>, <sense id="n49729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of one mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of one accord</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">socia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 22, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
unanimis: <entryFree id="n49730" type="main" key="u_na^ni^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnănĭmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of one mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accordant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harmonious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unanimous</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">fratres, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 231: equi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epigr. 37, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. unianimis, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:134" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 134</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnănĭmĭ-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unanimously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cordially</hi>: me delegistis,<cb n="UNCO" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Tac. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">studere patientiae (opp. discordare),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pat. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
unanimitas: <entryFree id="n49731" type="main" key="u_na^ni^mi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnănĭmĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>unanimus</etym>, <sense id="n49731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unanimity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concord</hi> (very rare; cf.: concordia, consensus): egregia, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 101, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">142, 32</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 109 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">fraterna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8, 14</bibl></cit>; Hilar. Trin. 1, 28.</sense></entryFree>
unanimiter: <entryFree id="n49732" type="main" key="u_na^ni^mi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnănĭmĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. unanimis <sense id="n49732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
unanimus: <entryFree id="n49733" type="main" key="u_na^ni^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnănĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unus-animus</etym>, <sense id="n49733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of one mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heart</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">will; of one accord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concordant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harmonious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unanimous</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ego tu sum, tu's ego: unanimi sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 49</bibl></cit> ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sodales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:669" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 669</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:615" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 615</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:161" default="NO">4, 161</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 21, 5</bibl>, the correct read. is una animos).</sense></entryFree>
unasyllabus: <entryFree id="n49734" type="main" key="u_na^sylla^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnăsyllăbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vox. hybr. unus-<foreign lang="greek">sullabh/</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n49734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of one syllable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praepositiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 14, p. 984</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
uncatio: <entryFree id="n49735" type="main" key="unca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">uncātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>uncatus</etym>, <sense id="n49735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bending inwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hooking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curving</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:32" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 32 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
uncatus: <entryFree id="n49736" type="main" key="unca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">uncātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>uncus</etym>, <sense id="n49736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bent inwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hooked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curved</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n49736.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanceae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49736.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">bent down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bowed down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quidam uncati permaneant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:3:57" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 3, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49736.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hooked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barbed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllogismi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
uncia: <entryFree id="n49737" type="greek" key="unci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">uncĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ou)gki/a</foreign> (Siculian and Etruscan; v. Müller, Etrusk. 1, p. 309 sq.) [akin to unus, unicus, unio; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">oi)no/s</foreign>], <sense id="n49737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the twelfth part</hi> of any thing, <hi rend="ital">a twelfth.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49737.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49737.2" n="1" level="3"> Of inheritances: <cit><quote lang="la">mortuus Babullius. Caesar, opinor, ex unciā, etsi nihil adhuc: sed Lepta ex triente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 48, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:28" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 28 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 27, 2</bibl>.—Of a debt: <cit><quote lang="la">non erit uncia tota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:3:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49737.3" n="2" level="3"> To denote a rate of interest, <hi rend="ital">one twelfth per cent.</hi> a month, i. e. reckoning by the year, <hi rend="ital">one per cent.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:47:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 47, § 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n49737.4" n="3" level="3"> As a weight, <hi rend="ital">the twelfth part of a pound</hi> (as or libra), <hi rend="ital">an ounce</hi>, Rhemn. Fan. Pond. 28; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uncia aloës,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Falerni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:107:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 107, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49737.5" n="4" level="3"> As a measure of land, <hi rend="ital">one twelfth of a</hi> jugerum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49737.6" n="5" level="3"> As a measure of length, <hi rend="ital">the twelfth part of a foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an inch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 24" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 34, 39, § 214</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n49737.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a trifle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">atom</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque piscium ullam unciam hodie Pondo cepi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:131" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla de nostro nobis uncia venit apro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:49:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 49, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
uncialis: <entryFree id="n49738" type="main" key="unci^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">uncĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>uncia</etym>, <sense id="n49738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a twelfth part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amounting to a twelfth part</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asses,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>weighing an ounce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 45</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">uva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altitudo,</quote> <trans><tr>of an inch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 16, 43, § 146</bibl></cit>; so, litterae, Hier. prol. in Job <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
unciarius: <entryFree id="n49739" type="main" key="unci^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">uncĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a twelfth part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">containing a twelfth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heres,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who inherits a twelfth part</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:34" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: fenus, i. e. one twelfth of the principal was returned annually as interest, or 8 1/3 <hi rend="ital">per cent.</hi> (cf. Rein, Privatr. 630 sqq.; Marquardt, Röm. Alterth. 3, 2, 48); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 27, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex, i. e. de fenore unciario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=375" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 375</bibl></cit>: unciariā stipe collatā, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of an</hi> as (weighing one ounce), <hi rend="ital">from each person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 5, 11, § 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <trans><tr>bearing grapes that weigh an ounce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 5, 17</bibl></sense></entryFree>
unciatim: <entryFree id="n49740" type="main" key="unci^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">uncĭātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by twelfths</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by ounces.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n49740.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(axungia) datur et phthisicis unciatim, cum vini veteris hemina decocta, donec tres unciae e toto restent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 37, § 139</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n49740.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">by a little at a time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little by little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ille unciatim vix de demenso suo ... comparsit miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
uncinatus: <entryFree id="n49741" type="hapax" key="unci_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">uncīnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>uncinus</etym>, <sense id="n49741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with hooks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tenters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barbed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hamata uncinataque corpora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 121</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
uncinus: <entryFree id="n49742" type="main" key="unci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">uncīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. uncus</etym>, <sense id="n49742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barb</hi> (late Lat. for 1. uncus), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 135, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 29</bibl>; Vnlg. Exod. 28, 13. —As <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">hamus,</quote> <trans><tr>barbed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 20, 270</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
unciola: <entryFree id="n49743" type="hapax" key="unci^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">uncĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>uncia</etym>, <sense id="n49743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little ounce</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:40" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uncipes: <entryFree id="n49744" type="main" key="unci^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">uncĭ-pēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. uncus</etym>, <sense id="n49744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having feet bent in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crook-footed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
unco: <entryFree id="n49745" type="main" key="unco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n49745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sound</hi> or <hi rend="ital">roar like a bear</hi>, Carm. Philom. 50. <cb n="UNDA" /></sense></entryFree>
unctio: <entryFree id="n49746" type="main" key="uncti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ungo</etym>, <sense id="n49746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a besmearing. anointing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49746.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudatoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cottidiana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:53:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 53, 3</bibl></cit>. philosophorum omnes unctionis causā relinquunt, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to go and anoint themselves</hi> for wrestling in the palæstra, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49746.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an ointment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unguent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ut unctio inarescat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 47, § 171</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
unctito: <entryFree id="n49747" type="main" key="uncti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unctĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to besmear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">anoint often</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">se unguentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 117</bibl></cit>: flavo cinere (crinem), Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 698</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
unctiusculus: <entryFree id="n49748" type="hapax" key="uncti^uscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unctĭuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n49748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [unctus, from ungo], <hi rend="ital">somewhat unctuous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 85</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
unctor: <entryFree id="n49749" type="main" key="unctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unctor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ungo</etym>, <sense id="n49749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an anointer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:70:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 70, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:32:6" default="NO">7, 32, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:70:3" default="NO">12, 70, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 24, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 26</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 6, 10, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2791</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 785, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
unctorium: <entryFree id="n49750" type="main" key="uncto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unctōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. cubiculum) [unctor], <sense id="n49750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the anointing-room</hi> in a bath, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 11</bibl>; cf. elaeothesium.</sense></entryFree>
unctulus: <entryFree id="n49751" type="main" key="unctu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unctŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n49751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [unctus, from ungo], <hi rend="ital">besmeared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anointed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49751.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: circumtonsi et terti atque unctuli, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 179, 8</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n49751.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">unctŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a little ointment</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 139, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
unctum: <entryFree id="n49752" type="main" key="unctum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unctum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. ungo, <sense id="n49752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
unctura: <entryFree id="n49753" type="hapax" key="unctu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unctūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ungo</etym>, <sense id="n49753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an anointing</hi> of the dead: <cit><quote lang="la">servilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:24:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 24, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
unctus: <entryFree id="n49754" type="main" key="unctus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of ungo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49755" type="main" key="unctus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ungo</etym>, <sense id="n49755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an anointing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anointment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum unctui profer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 113, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cochlearum cinis cum melle unctu sanat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 10, 27, § 90</bibl></cit> (al. linitu).</sense></entryFree>
uncus: <entryFree id="n49756" type="greek" key="uncus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">uncus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root ak, ankami, bend; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)gkw/n, o)/gkos</foreign>; cf.: ancus, ungulus</etym>, <sense id="n49756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barb.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49756.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 10, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 18, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13</bibl>.—As an attribute of Necessitas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 20</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an anchor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:428" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 428</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49756.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n49756.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A hook that was fastened to the neck of condemned criminals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and by which they were dragged to the Tiber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; id. rab. Perd. 5, 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:168" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:66" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 66</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et bene cum fixum mento discusseris uncum, Nil erit hoc: rostro te premet ansa suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 141. —</sense><sense id="n49756.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A surgical instrument</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49757" type="main" key="uncus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">uncus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. uncus</etym>, <sense id="n49757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hooked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bent in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crooked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barbed</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: curvus, recurvus): uncus hamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 476</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called unca aera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua (tauri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:5:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aratrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 341</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 210</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vomer aratri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 313</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called dens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes (harpyiae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:11:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 371</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 588</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1407" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1407</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49757.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">unco non alligat ancora morsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avis Minervae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with crooked beak and talons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:507" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 507</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">alites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 212</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
unda: <entryFree id="n49758" type="main" key="unda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root ud-, und-, to be wet; whence, uda, water; Angl. -Sax. ydhu, wave; Slav. voda, water; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(/dwr, u(a/des</foreign>; Goth. vatō, water</etym>, <sense id="n49758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">billow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surge</hi> (syn. fluctus). </sense><sense id="n49758.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare plenum undarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 33</bibl></cit>: unda, cum est pulsa remis, purpurascit, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 162, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">via, quae fert Acherontis ad undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 295</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 374</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:380" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 380</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:494" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 494</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 14, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:570" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 570</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Collect.: prora remissa subito navem undae adfligebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 34, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49758.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49758.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n49758.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moisture</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua, lympha): (Proteus) flumen eras, interdum undis contrarius ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:737" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 737</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontis in undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 98</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fons tenui perlucidus undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:161" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Noti) canis fluit unda capillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:266" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivales,</quote> <trans><tr>snow-water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:118:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 118, 1</bibl></cit>: ignem Pollux undamque jugalem Praetulit, <hi rend="ital">fire and water</hi>, as symbols of housekeeping, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:245" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 245</bibl>, hence, faciunt justos ignis et unda viros, i. e. <hi rend="ital">real</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proper husbands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:598" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 598</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49758.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A fluid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liquid.</hi> manans naribus unda Sangninis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:245" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 245</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">preli,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>oil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">croci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:33" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 33</bibl></cit>. 4; <cit><quote lang="la">13, 40, 1.—Cf the lava from Ætna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:Aet. 303" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> Aet. 303</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49758.6"
