n="2" level="3"> Of wavelike things (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): aëriae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the air</hi>, Lucr. <pb n="1930" /> <cb n="UNDE" /> 2, 152: <cit><quote lang="la">quā plurimus undam Fumus agit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 257</bibl></cit>.—Of a lion's mane, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:55:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 55, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49758.7" n="3" level="3"> In architecture, for the Gr. cymatium (<foreign lang="greek">kumati/on</foreign>, a little wave), <hi rend="ital">a talon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ogee</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49758.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of the wavelike agitation of a multitude, etc., <hi rend="ital">a surge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">billow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stream</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tide</hi>, = aestus: <cit><quote lang="la">campus atque illae undae comitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc agilis fio et mersor civilibus undis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversis rerum immersabilis undis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 507</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutantūm unda,</quote> <trans><tr>a stream</tr>, <tr>crowd</tr>, <tr>throng</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 462</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">undae Boiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:159" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 159</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undabundus: <entryFree id="n49759" type="main" key="unda_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>undo</etym>, <sense id="n49759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of waves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">billowy</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:30:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 7, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undanter: <entryFree id="n49760" type="main" key="undanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. undo <sense id="n49760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
undatim: <entryFree id="n49761" type="main" key="unda_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>undo</etym>, <sense id="n49761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a waving manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like waves</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae undatim crispae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 15, 30, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crispum marmor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 7, 11, § 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49761.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In a throng</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
unde: <entryFree id="n49762" type="main" key="unde^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n49762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from which place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whence.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49762.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place. </sense><sense id="n49762.2" n="A" level="2"> Correlatively: <cit><quote lang="la">petere inde coronam Unde prius nulli velarint tempora musae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec enim inde venit, unde mallem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi, unde huc translata essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:16:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 16, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eo restituerentur (Galli), unde dejecti essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:30:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 30, 88</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">te redigam eodem, unde orta es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem, unde erant profectae (naves),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so too, eodem, unde,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad idem, unde profecta sunt, redire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:22:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 22, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes, unde hauriretis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 46, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latobrigos in fines suos, unde erant profecti, reverti jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca superiora, unde erat propinquus despectus in mare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad summi fastigia culminis unde Tela jactabant Teucri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 458</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna, Unde genus ducis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 801</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor, unde auri aura refulsit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montis sublime cacumen Occupat, unde sedens partes speculetur in omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:667" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 667</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49762.3" n="2" level="3"> Pregn.: e majoribus castris, unde antea cessatum fuerat, brevi spatio circumductae copiae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">from the place at which</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 13, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arcem perfugere, unde biduo post deditio facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:46:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 46, 16</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49762.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> </sense><sense id="n49762.5" n="1" level="3"> In a direct interrog.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc verbum unde utrumque declarat, et ex quo loco et a quo loco. Unde dejectus est Cinna? Ex urbe ... Unde dejecti Galli? A Capitolio. Unde qui cum Graccho fuerunt? Ex Capitolio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:30:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 30, 87</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Unde is? <hi rend="ital">Chae.</hi> Egone? nescio hercle, neque unde eam, neque quorsum eam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 14</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Mn.</hi> Unde eam (mulierem) esse aiunt? <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Ex Samo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui genus? unde domo?</quote> <trans><tr>from what country?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 114</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gentium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde haec igitur gentium est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49762.6" n="2" level="3"> In an indirect interrog.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego instare, ut mihi responderet, quis esset, ubi esset, unde esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:77:section=188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 77, § 188</bibl></cit>: quaere unde domo (sit), <hi rend="ital">what his home is</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">where he lives</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis et unde genus .. Quaeris,</quote> <trans><tr>from what stock</tr>, <tr>of what family</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:22:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non recordor, unde ceciderim, sed unde surrexerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde initium belli fieret, explorabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde domo quisque sit quaere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Helv. 6:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Helv. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sciscitari unde natalium provenerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 165, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49762.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49762.8" n="A" level="2"> Apart from relations of place, and referring to persons or things, from which as an origin, source, cause, means, reason, etc., something proceeds, <hi rend="ital">from whom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from which.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49762.9" n="1" level="3"> Correlatively: <cit><quote lang="la">(narratio) brevis erit, si, unde necesse est, inde initium sumetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:20:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 20, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 9, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde jumenta nomen traxere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, praef. 3: <cit><quote lang="la">praedonibus, Unde emerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui eum necasset, unde ipse natus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:26:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 26, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potest fieri, ut is, unde te audisse dicis, iratus dixerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 285</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de eā (re) multo dicat ornatius, quam ille ipse, unde cognorit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illo exstincto Jove, unde discerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hem, mea lux, unde omnes opem petere solebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi, unde ne hostium quidem legati arcentur, pulsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ut ingenium et eloquentiam meam perspicias, unde longe absum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:92:318" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 92, 318</bibl></cit>: est unde haec <cb n="UNDE" /> fiant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuit permagnam Sextilius hereditatem, unde nummum nullum attigisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:17:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 17, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si habuerit, unde tibi solvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod, unde agger omnino comportari posset, nihil erat reliquum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardior stilus cogitationem moratur, rudis et confusus intellectu caret: unde sequitur alter dictandi labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:4" default="NO">12, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sciat (orator) quam plurima: unde etiam senibus auctoritas major est, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:4:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde jus stabat, ei victoriam dedit (= a quā parte stabat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">turbam, nec satis fido animo, unde pugnabat, stantem, in fugam averterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 15, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut unde stetisset, eo se victoria transferret,</quote> <trans><tr>on whose side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:4:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49762.10" n="b" level="4"> In partic., jurid. t. t.: unde petitur, <hi rend="ital">of whom demand is made</hi>, i. e. the defendant: si ambo pares essent, illi, unde petitur, potius credendum esse, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:26" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 26</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">causam dicere Prius unde petitur, aurum quare sit suom, Quam ille qui petit, unde is sit thesaurus sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 11 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 11 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego omnibus, unde petitur, hoc consilium dederim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulabat ut illi, unde peteretur, vetus exceptio daretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 37, 168</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49762.11" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> </sense><sense id="n49762.12" n="a" level="4"> In a direct interrog.: <cit><quote lang="la">unde haec (patera) igitur est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 158</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 10</bibl>: redde, ut huic reddatur. <hi rend="ital">Strob.</hi> Unde? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 5, 20</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Pi.</hi> Bonum habe animum. <hi rend="ital">Mn.</hi> Unde habeam? <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde iste amor tam improvisus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 22, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde sed hos novi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 508</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gentium: De.</hi> Face id ut paratum jam sit. <hi rend="ital">Li.</hi> Unde gentium? <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Me defraudato, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49762.13" n="b" level="4"> In an indirect interrog.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ex ipsā quaeras, unde hunc (anulum) habuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere, unde se ac suos tueri possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde concilietur risus ... difficillimum dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cogitaverimus, unde et quousque jam provecta sit orandi facultas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 16, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde sit infamis ... Discite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 285</bibl></cit>; cf. flor. 3, 12, 8 sqq.—</sense><sense id="n49762.14" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Indef.</hi>: unde unde for undecumque, <hi rend="ital">from wherever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whencesoever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from whatever quarter</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">et quaerendum unde unde foret nervosius illud,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nisi ... Mercedem aut numos unde unde extricat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen vindictae solacium unde unde spernendum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui malum etsi ipse non fecit, tamen a quocumque et unde unde passus est fieri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49762.15" n="2" level="3"> So, unde alone (late Lat.; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in Tert.): certe unde sunt ista, signis potius et ostentis deputanda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam possimus unde illas prolatas aestimare, dum ne ex nihilo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Herm. 22 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
undeceni: <entryFree id="n49763" type="spur" key="unde_ce_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undēcēni</orth>, a false read. for undenis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 8, 14, § 65</bibl>.</entryFree>
undecentesimus: <entryFree id="n49764" type="main" key="unde_cente_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undēcentēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>unde-centum</etym>, <sense id="n49764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the ninety-ninth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>, ext. 11.</sense></entryFree>
undecentum: <entryFree id="n49765" type="main" key="unde_centum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undēcentum</orth>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>unus-decentum</etym>, <sense id="n49765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ninety-nine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 60, 60, § 214</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undecies: <entryFree id="n49766" type="main" key="unde^ci^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undĕcĭes</orth>, <sense id="n49766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adv.</hi> [unus-decies], <hi rend="ital">eleven times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc summam undecies multiplicato, fiunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surrexi unā cenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:79:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 79, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undecim: <entryFree id="n49767" type="main" key="unde^ci^m"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undĕcĭm</orth>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>unus-decem</etym>, <sense id="n49767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eleven</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milia debeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:44:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 44, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undecimus: <entryFree id="n49768" type="main" key="unde^ci^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undĕcĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>unusdecimus</etym>, <sense id="n49768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the eleventh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 18, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 54, 118, § 283</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undeciremis: <entryFree id="n49769" type="main" key="unde^ci^re_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undĕcĭrēmis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. navis) [undecim-remus], <sense id="n49769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ship of eleven banks of oars</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 76, § 203</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
undecumani: <entryFree id="n49770" type="main" key="unde^cu^ma_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undĕcŭmāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>undecimus</etym>, <sense id="n49770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soldiers of the eleventh legion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
undecumque: <entryFree id="n49771" type="main" key="unde^cumque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undĕ-cumque</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">undĕ-cunque</orth>; <sense id="n49771.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in tmesi: unde vacefit cumque locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1017" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1017</bibl></cit>), <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">from wherever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whencesoever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from what place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">part soever</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">undecumque moti sunt (fluctus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 27:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluens sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 4, 5, § 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec undecumque causa fluxit, ibi culpa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: undecumque <cb n="UNDI" /> inceperis, ubicumque desieris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes transsiliunt protinus in naphtham undecumque visam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 105, 109, § 235</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Treb. Pol.</author> Trig. Tyr. 22, 4</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gentium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">undecumque gentium venissent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Firm. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undelibet: <entryFree id="n49772" type="main" key="unde^li^bet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undĕ-lĭbet</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n49772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">whence you will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whencesoever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from any place whatever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from anywhere</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">invenire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 50, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fascia undelibet super fracturam incipere debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 10, 1</bibl></cit>. —Also <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from whatever quarter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 36" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 36</bibl>, Serm. 3.</sense></entryFree>
undenarius: <entryFree id="n49773" type="main" key="unde_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>undeni</etym>, <sense id="n49773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing eleven</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 51" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:83" default="NO">83</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
undeni: <entryFree id="n49774" type="main" key="unde_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">un-dēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n49774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. distrib. adj.</hi> [unus], <hi rend="ital">eleven each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eleven</hi> distributively: <cit><quote lang="la">pariuntur undeni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 25, 30, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 8, 14, § 65</bibl></cit> Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Musa per undenos emodulanda pedes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with a hexameter and pentameter</tr>, <tr>elegiac verse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me quater undenos sciat implevisse Decembres,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>forty-four years</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 27</bibl></cit>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">bisque undena pars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 451</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undenonaginta: <entryFree id="n49775" type="main" key="unde_no_na_ginta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undēnōnāginta</orth>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>unus-denonaginta</etym>, <sense id="n49775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eighty-nine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis undenonaginta navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 30, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undeoctoginta: <entryFree id="n49776" type="main" key="unde^octo_ginta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undĕoctōginta</orth>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>unus-deoctoginta</etym>, <sense id="n49776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seventy-nine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde-Octoginta annos natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undequadragesimus: <entryFree id="n49777" type="main" key="unde_quadra_ge_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undēquadrāgēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>undequadraginta</etym>, <sense id="n49777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the thirty-ninth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>, ext. 10.</sense></entryFree>
undequadragies: <entryFree id="n49778" type="main" key="unde_quadra_gies"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undēquadrāgies</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭens</orth>, <sense id="n49778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adv.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">thirty - nine times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 25, 25, § 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undequadraginta: <entryFree id="n49779" type="main" key="unde_quadra_ginta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undēquadrāginta</orth>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>unusde-quadraginta</etym>, <sense id="n49779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thirty - nine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 14, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undequinquagesimus: <entryFree id="n49780" type="main" key="unde_quinqua_ge_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undēquinquāgēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>undequinquaginta</etym>, <sense id="n49780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the forty-ninth</hi> dies, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:17:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 17, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
undequinquaginta: <entryFree id="n49781" type="main" key="unde_quinqua_ginta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undēquinquāginta</orth>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>unus de-quinquaginta</etym>, <sense id="n49781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">forty-nine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronae aureae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 58, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undesexagesimus: <entryFree id="n49782" type="main" key="unde_sexa_ge_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undēsexāgēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>undesexaginta</etym>, <sense id="n49782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fifty-ninth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undesexaginta: <entryFree id="n49783" type="main" key="unde_sexaginta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undēsexaginta</orth>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>unus-desexaginta</etym>, <sense id="n49783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fifty-nine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">undesexaginta (Carthaginiensium) vivi capti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 37, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 122</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undetriceni: <entryFree id="n49784" type="main" key="unde_tri_ce_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undētrīcēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n49784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. distr. adj.</hi> [undetriginta], <hi rend="ital">twenty-nine each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twentynine</hi> distributively: <cit><quote lang="la">menses undetricenum tricenumque (dierum) numero alternaverunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 13, § 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undetricesimus: <entryFree id="n49785" type="main" key="unde_tri_ce_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undētrīcēsĭmus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">undētrīgē-sĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the twentyninth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:36:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 36, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in commentariorum undetricesimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:5:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undetrigesimus: <entryFree id="n49786" type="main" key="unde_tri_ge_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undētrīgēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. undetricesimus.</entryFree>
undetriginta: <entryFree id="n49787" type="main" key="unde_tri_ginta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undētrīginta</orth>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>unus-detriginta</etym>, <sense id="n49787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twenty-nine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">menses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 15, § 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undeviceni: <entryFree id="n49788" type="main" key="unde_vi_ce_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undēvīcēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n49788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. distr. adj.</hi> [undeviginti], <hi rend="ital">nineteen each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nineteen</hi> distributively: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undevicesimani: <entryFree id="n49789" type="main" key="unde_vi_ce_si^ma_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undēvīcēsĭmāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>undevicesimus</etym>, <sense id="n49789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soldiers of the nineteenth legion</hi>: cum quinque cohortibus undevicesimanorum egreditur, Auct. B. Alex. 57, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
undevicesimus: <entryFree id="n49790" type="main" key="unde_vi_ce_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undēvīcēsĭmus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">undēvīgēsĭ-mus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>undeviginti</etym>, <sense id="n49790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the nineteenth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anno undevicesimo post ejus mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expleto aetatis undevicesimo anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, praef. § 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 45</bibl> (al. unetvicesimus): <cit><quote lang="la">die undevigesimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 14</bibl></cit>.—The second and third syllable scanned short: senserat ire aquilas legio undevigesima, cujus, etc., Poët. ap. Anth. Lat. 2, p. 21.</sense></entryFree>
undeviginti: <entryFree id="n49791" type="main" key="unde_vi_ginti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undēvīginti</orth>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>unus-de-viginti</etym>, <sense id="n49791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nineteen</hi>: undeviginti annos natus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:64:229" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 64, 229</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa militaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:46:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 46, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undicola: <entryFree id="n49792" type="main" key="undi^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>unda-colo</etym>, <sense id="n49792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wavedwelling</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">inhabiting the waves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dwelling in the sea</hi>: Naïades, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 250, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pistris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 808</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undifluus: <entryFree id="n49793" type="main" key="undi_^flu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undī^flŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unda-fluo</etym>, <sense id="n49793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flow</hi> <pb n="1931" /> <cb n="UNDO" /> <hi rend="ital">ing with waves</hi>: amnes, Dracont. Hexaëm. 1, 607.</sense></entryFree>
undifragus: <entryFree id="n49794" type="main" key="undi^fra^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undĭfrăgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unda-frango</etym>, <sense id="n49794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wave-breaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that breaks the waves</hi> or <hi rend="ital">water</hi>: fluctus, Ven. 3 prol.</sense></entryFree>
undique: <entryFree id="n49795" type="main" key="undi^que^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undĭquĕ</orth>, <sense id="n49795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv. indef.</hi> [unde-que, prop. whencesoever; hence], <hi rend="ital">from all parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sides</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">places</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from every quarter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on all sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on every part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">everywhere</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut undique uno tempore in hostes impetus fieret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicus altissimis montibus undique continetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinctus periculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus undique collectis, arcessitis, comportatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:24:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 24, 92</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">carpere et colligere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 42, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carpere atque delibare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:56:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 56, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic undique omni ratione concluditur,</quote> <trans><tr>on all grounds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:53:132" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 53, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes undique copiae conferuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:17:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 17, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concurritur undique ad istum Syracusas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:53:section=133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 53, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique ad inferos tantumdem viae est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:43:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 43, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura undique perfecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:9:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 9, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 24, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes enim partes ejus (i. e. mundi) undique medium locum capessentes nituntur aequaliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:45:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 45, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delirus et amens Undique dicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soluta ac velut labens undique toga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:147" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique omnes conisi hostem avertunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:63:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 63, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique omnis copias contrahit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:38" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49795.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Utterly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entirely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in all respects</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut undique religionem tolle aut usque quāque conserva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:43:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 43, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita undique referta bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:31:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 31, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam quid fere undique placet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49795.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n49795.3" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gentium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in every quarter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in every part of the world</hi>: pacato undique gentium toto, quā patet, orbe terrarum, Edict. Aurelian. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Firm. 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49795.4" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">laterum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes rabidi et immanes undique laterum circumfusi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 209, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49795.5" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">versus</hi> (<hi rend="ital">versum</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">marinae aurae undique versus assidui flatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:1:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Oceanus omnes terras omnifariam et undique versum circumfluat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:13:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 13, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:16:6" default="NO">7, 16, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 322, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 40 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n49795.6" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">secus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique secus agris arentibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undisonus: <entryFree id="n49796" type="main" key="undi^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undĭsŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unda-sono</etym>, <sense id="n49796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wave-sounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sounding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">roaring with the waves</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:44" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Psamathe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:364" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dei,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sea-gods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 21, 18.</sense></entryFree>
undivagus: <entryFree id="n49797" type="main" key="undi^va^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undĭvăgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unda-vagus</etym>, <sense id="n49797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wandering in waves</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">latices, Coripp. Johan. 6, 342: salum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:ib. 7:344" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tethys,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 2, p. 303</bibl></cit> Burm.</sense></entryFree>
undo: <entryFree id="n49798" type="main" key="undo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n49798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [unda]. </sense><sense id="n49798.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rise in waves</hi> or <hi rend="ital">surges</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to throw up waves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to surge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swell</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose). </sense><sense id="n49798.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: undantem salum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 223, 24</bibl> (Trag. v. 226 Vahl.); cf.: undanti in freto, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:35:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 35, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solet aestus aequinoctialis ... undare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:28:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 28, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad caelum undabat vortex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 673</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëna undantia flammis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 218</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49798.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49798.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To overflow with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be full of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abound in</hi> any thing, = abundare: <cit><quote lang="la">regio Undat equis floretque viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:539" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 539</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:449" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 449</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva favis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ima (aedium) viris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 545</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49798.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To wave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undulate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidimus undantem ruptis fornacibus Aetnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 472</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undantes flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:446" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 446</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undante fumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undans buxo Cytorus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 437</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undans chlamys,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undantes habenae,</quote> <trans><tr>waving</tr>, <tr>flowing</tr>, <tr>hanging loosely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 471</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">undantia lora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa (puella) decenter undabat,</quote> <trans><tr>undulated</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 117, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49798.6" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to waver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fluctuate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be agitated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">undans curis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:304" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undantes spumis furialibus irae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 1, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49798.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (very rare), <hi rend="ital">to overflow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inundate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deluge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine campos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus cruore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 2, 67</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">undātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">in a wavy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wave-like form</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concharum genera imbricatim undata, cancellatim reticulata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 103</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">undan-ter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">in a waving manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like waves</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillus undanter fluens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 122, 7</bibl></cit> (al. fluenter undans): <cit><quote lang="la">evomere talia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 138</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undose: <entryFree id="n49799" type="main" key="undo_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. undosus <sense id="n49799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <cb n="UNGU" /></sense></entryFree>
undosus: <entryFree id="n49800" type="main" key="undo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unda</etym>, <sense id="n49800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of waves</hi> or <hi rend="ital">surges</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surgy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">billowy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Plemyrium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 693</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:21" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: torrentes, Aug. Civ. Dei, 27, 11. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">undōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in waves; comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">undosius labens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
undulatus: <entryFree id="n49801" type="hapax" key="undu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">undŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>undo, I. B. 2. and II. <hi rend="ital">p. a.</hi></etym>, <sense id="n49801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">diversified as with waves</hi> (like watered stuffs), <hi rend="ital">undulated</hi>: togae, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 189, 26</bibl> (cited also in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 74, § 195</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
unedo: <entryFree id="n49802" type="main" key="u_ne^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĕdo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the arbute</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strawberry-tree;</hi> and also <hi rend="ital">its fruit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 24, 28, § 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:151" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 8, 79, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
unelli: <entryFree id="n49803" type="main" key="Unelli"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Unelli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in</hi> Gallia Lugdunensis, <hi rend="ital">bordering on the Curiosolitœ and Lexovii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose country formed part of the</hi> Tractus Armoricus; <hi rend="ital">their chief city was</hi> Constantini Castra, now <hi rend="ital">Coutances</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 17</bibl>; 7, 75; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 18, 32, § 107</bibl> (Jahn, Venelli).</sense></entryFree>
unetvicesimani: <entryFree id="n49804" type="main" key="u_netvi_ce_si^ma_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnetvīcēsĭmāni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ūnăet-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>unetvicesimus</etym>, <sense id="n49804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soldiers of the twentyfirst legion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
unetvicesimus: <entryFree id="n49805" type="main" key="u_netvi_ce_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnetvīcēsĭmus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ūnăet-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>unus-et-vicesimus</etym>, <sense id="n49805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the twentyfirst</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 45</bibl></cit> (al. undevicesimus).</sense></entryFree>
ungella: <entryFree id="n49806" type="main" key="ungella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ungella</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">unguella</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ungula</etym>, <sense id="n49806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little claw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">talon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:5" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 20 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
ungo: <entryFree id="n49807" type="main" key="ungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ungo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">unguo</orth>, <itype>nxi, nctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root in Sanscr. ang, to besmear; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/gos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n49807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to smear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besmear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anoint</hi> with any fat substance, an unguent, oil, etc. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: lino, linio): unguentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:35:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 35, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam unguentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unctus est, accubuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:52:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 52, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria quem supra vires unguit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 22</bibl></cit>; Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 76</bibl>.—Of the anointing of corpses, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 219</bibl> (Ann. v. 156 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:9:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 9, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:853" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 853</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 10, 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:12:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:26" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">globos melle,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postes superbos amaracino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1175</bibl></cit> et saep.—Of the anointing of a Jewish king: <cit><quote lang="la">unctus est in regem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 1, 45, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caules oleo,</quote> <trans><tr>to dress with oil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caules impensius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:68" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingui oluscula lardo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 64</bibl></cit>: labitur uncta carina, <hi rend="ital">daubed with pitch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the pitchy keel</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 379 and 476); imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 398</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">labitur uncta vadis abies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 91</bibl></cit>: ungere tela manu ferrumque armare, <hi rend="ital">to smear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">anoint with poison</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">i)ou\s xri/esqai</foreign>), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 773</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma uncta cruoribus,</quote> <trans><tr>smeared</tr>, <tr>stained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela cruore hostili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:13" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova ranae sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:19" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer unctis Tractavit calicem manibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>greasy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 78</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">uncta aqua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 68</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49807.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:10:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 10, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Cor. 1, 21</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">unctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a.;</hi> prop. <hi rend="ital">anointed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oiled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur quisquam caput unctius referret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis diliges ex duobus aeque bonis viris nitidum et unctum quam pulverulentum et horrentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Achivi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudus, unctus, ebrius est contionatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49807.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">luxurious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuous</hi> (syn. lautus). </sense><sense id="n49807.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">captus es unctiore cenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:44:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 44, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius et unctius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenae unctissimae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita palaestritas defendebat, ut ab illis ipse unctior abiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:22:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 22, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedes siccus ad unctum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:29:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 29, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corinthus,</quote> <trans><tr>luxurious</tr>, <tr>voluptuous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:113" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarentus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 430</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro isto asso sole, quo tu abusus es in nostro pratulo, a te nitidum solem unctumque repetemus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sunshine and ointment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unctior splendidiorque consuetudo loquendi,</quote> <trans><tr>rich</tr>, <tr>copious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:20:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 20, 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49807.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">unctum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n49807.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A rich banquet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuous feast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unctum qui recte ponere possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 422</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenare sine uncto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:16" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49807.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An ointment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haurito plusculo uncto, corporis mei membra perfricui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 71, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
unguedo: <entryFree id="n49808" type="hapax" key="ungue_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unguēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>unguo, ungo</etym>, <sense id="n49808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ointment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unguent</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 138, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
unguen: <entryFree id="n49809" type="main" key="unguen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unguen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fatty substance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fat; an ointment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unguent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aënum caldum unguen indito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">80</bibl>: pingues<cb n="UNGU" />  unguine ceras, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 450</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cras. sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:40" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:360" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 360</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:302 al" default="NO">8, 302 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
unguentarius: <entryFree id="n49810" type="main" key="unguenta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unguentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unguentum</etym>, <sense id="n49810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to ointments</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unguents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ointment-.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49810.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: taberna, Varr L. L. 8, 30, 117; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 8, 12, § 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49810.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49810.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">unguentārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dealer in unguents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a perfumer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 42, 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:46:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 46, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 228</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 42, § 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2988</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n49810.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">unguentārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n49810.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A female perfumer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 5, 5, § 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4301</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4991</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49810.6" n="2" level="3"> (Sc. ars.) <hi rend="ital">The art of making unguents</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perfumes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 90</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49810.7" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">unguentārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. argentum), <hi rend="ital">money for buying perfumes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
unguento: <entryFree id="n49811" type="main" key="unguento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unguento</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rub with sweet ointments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to anoint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfume</hi> (in <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> very rare): DEAS VNGVENTAVERVNT, Inscr. Fratr. Arval. Orell. 2271, 391 (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:35:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 35, § 77</bibl>).—More freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">unguentātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">anointed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfumed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentatus per vias, ignave, incedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cincinni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: homo, P. Scipio Afric. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:12:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Fragm. ib. 12:2:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Fragm. ib. 12, 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 142</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
unguentum: <entryFree id="n49812" type="main" key="unguentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unguentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<sense id="n49812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> unguentūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 88</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>unguo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">an ointment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unguent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfume</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non omnes possunt olere unguenta exotica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 115</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25, § 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 8, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 11, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 375</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 16</bibl> (4, 15), 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:561" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 561</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:54:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 54, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 1, 1, 1, § 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
unguiculus: <entryFree id="n49813" type="main" key="ungui^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unguĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>unguis</etym>, <sense id="n49813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a finger-nail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">integritas unguiculorum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:27:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 27, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:2:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 2, 5</bibl>.—Prov.: a teneris unguiculis, a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)c a(palw=n o)nu/xwn</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">from early infancy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from childhood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 6, 2</bibl> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">de tenero ungui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 24</bibl></cit>): ex unguiculis (= <foreign lang="greek">e)c o)nu/xwn</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">from the very finger-tips</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">through and through</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 249, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
unguilla: <entryFree id="n49814" type="hapax" key="unguilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unguilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>unguo, ungo</etym>, <sense id="n49814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ointment-box</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
unguinosus: <entryFree id="n49815" type="main" key="ungui^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unguĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unguen</etym>, <sense id="n49815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of fat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">oil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unctuous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 77, § 147</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
unguis: <entryFree id="n49816" type="main" key="unguis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unguis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>abl.</case> ungui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:39" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 39</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 120</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*o*n*u*x-, o)/nuc</foreign>; Sanscr. nakha</etym>, <sense id="n49816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nail</hi> of a person's finger or toe. </sense><sense id="n49816.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 101, § 247</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:106" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 35, 52, § 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:28" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 2, 5, § 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 19, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:39" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 7, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:708" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 708</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49816.2" n="2" level="3"> Of animals. <hi rend="ital">a claw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">talon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hoof</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 101, § 247</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 717</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 540</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:199 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 199 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n49816.3" n="B" level="2"> Proverbial phrases. </sense><sense id="n49816.4" n="1" level="3"> Ab imis unguibus usque ad verticem summum, <hi rend="ital">from top to toe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from the crown of his head to the sole of his foot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49816.5" n="2" level="3"> A rectā conscientiā transversum unguem non discedere, <hi rend="ital">not to depart a finger's breadth in the least</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 20, 4</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ellipt.: urge igitur, nec transversum unguem, quod aiunt, a stilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tu ex isto loco digitum transvorsum aut unguem latum excesseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:17 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 17 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 127, 8</bibl> (v. transversus and digitus).—</sense><sense id="n49816.6" n="3" level="3"> Cum medium ostenderet unguem, i. e. <hi rend="ital">showed utter derision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the greatest contempt</hi> (because the middle finger was regarded as indecent), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:53" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49816.7" n="4" level="3"> Incestos amores De tenero meditatur ungui, i. e. <hi rend="ital">from childhood</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">e)c a(palw=n o\nu/xwn</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 24</bibl> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">a teneris unguiculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n49816.8" n="5" level="3"> Ad or in unguem, after the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ei)s o)/nuxa</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">e)p) o)/nuxos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to a hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to a nicety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exactly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfectly</hi> (an expression borrowed from sculptors, who, in modelling, give the finishing touch with the nail; <cit><quote lang="la">or joiners, who test the accuracy of joints in wood by the nail: materiem dolare ad unguem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad unguem Factus homo,</quote> <trans><tr>highly polished</tr>, <tr>perfectly accomplished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen decies castigare ad unguem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 294</bibl></cit> Jan. ad loc.: suturae capitis<pb n="1932" /> <cb n="UNIC" />  in unguem committuntur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 277</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6, 2</bibl>;
