cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: carmina molli numero fluere, ut per leve severos effundat junctura unguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:65" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49816.9" n="6" level="3"> Homo, cujus pluris erat unguis, quam tu totus es, <hi rend="ital">a man whose little finger was worth more than your whole body</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 57 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n49816.10" n="7" level="3"> Rodere ungues, <hi rend="ital">to bite the nails</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be buried in thought</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ille in versu faciendo Saepe caput scaberet vivos et roderet ungues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 71</bibl></cit>; cf.: ungue meam morso saepe querere fidem. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 25, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">et saepe inmeritos corrumpas dentibus ungues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit> (13).—</sense><sense id="n49816.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49816.12" n="A" level="2"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">a nail-like spot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the tip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extremity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 9, 19, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:121" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 18, 73, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 12, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49816.13" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of shell-fish</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the razor-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:12:23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 12, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49816.14" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A hook</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 18, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49816.15" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A white skin on the eye</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a web</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haw</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">pteru/gion</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ungula: <entryFree id="n49817" type="main" key="ungu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ungŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>unguis</etym>. <sense id="n49817.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a hoof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">claw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">talon;</hi> of a horse: totam quatit ungula terram, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 231 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:596" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 596</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 5, 11</bibl>.—Of a swine, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 158, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 14</bibl>.—Of oxen: <cit><quote lang="la">bisulca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 21, 30, § 72</bibl></cit>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">claws</hi> of hens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3</bibl>. 4, 8.—Of vultures' and eagles' <hi rend="ital">talons</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 63</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">toto corpore atque omnibus ungulis, i. e., as we say,</quote> <trans><tr>with tooth and nail</tr>, <tr>with might and main</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49817.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49817.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a horse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum carceribus missos rapit ungula currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:50:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 50, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49817.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A claw</hi>, an instrument of torture (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 9, 18, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 1, 44; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49817.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An aromatic spice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 24, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ungulatros: <entryFree id="n49818" type="main" key="ungu^latros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ungŭlatros</orth> <itype>ungues magnos atque asperos Cato appellavit</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=279" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 279</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n49818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ungulatus: <entryFree id="n49819" type="main" key="ungu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ungŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ungula</etym>, <sense id="n49819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having claws</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hoofs</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">altero pede ungulatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 378</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ungulus: <entryFree id="n49820" type="main" key="ungu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ungŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Oscan; Sanscr. ankami, bend; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)gku/los</foreign>, crooked; Lat. ancus, aduncus; cf. angulus</etym>, <sense id="n49820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a finger-ring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a ring</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ungulus Oscorum linguā anulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=375" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 375</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(anulum) apud nos prisci ungulum vocabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>; Poët. ap. Fest. l. l.; so Pac. ib. (Trag. Fragm. v. 64, 215 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
unguo: <entryFree id="n49821" type="main" key="unguo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unguo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. ungo.</entryFree>
ungustus: <entryFree id="n49822" type="gloss" key="ungustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ungustus</orth> <itype>fustis uncus</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=377" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 377</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
unianimis: <entryFree id="n49823" type="main" key="u_ni^a^ni^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭ-ănĭmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, = unanimis, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:134" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 134</bibl>.</entryFree>
unicalamus: <entryFree id="n49824" type="hapax" key="u_ni^ca^la^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭ-călămus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unus</etym>, <sense id="n49824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a single stem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">straw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 12, § 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
unicaulis: <entryFree id="n49825" type="main" key="u_ni^caulis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭ-caulis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a single stalk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus carduorum silvestrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 23, 99, § 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faba leguminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 10, 57, § 176</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
unice: <entryFree id="n49826" type="main" key="u_ni^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. unicus <sense id="n49826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
uniceps: <entryFree id="n49827" type="main" key="u_ni^ceps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭceps</orth>, <itype>cĭpĭtis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n49827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one-headed</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Jul. ap. Aug. c. Sec. Resp. Jul. 5, 15.</sense></entryFree>
unicolor: <entryFree id="n49828" type="main" key="u_ni^co^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭ-cŏlor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype> (collat. form <sense id="n49828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi> unicoloras animas, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 821</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">of one color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all of one</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the same color</hi> (opp. varius, differens): <cit><quote lang="la">sues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 54, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 611</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
unicornis: <entryFree id="n49829" type="main" key="u_ni^cornis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭcornis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unus-cornu</etym>, <sense id="n49829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">onehorned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having a single horn.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49829.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Indici boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 21, 30, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 46, 106, § 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhinoceros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Jud. 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49829.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:91:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 91, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
unicornuus: <entryFree id="n49830" type="main" key="u_ni^cornu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭcornŭus</orth>, <itype>ui</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>unicornis</etym>, pure Lat. for monoceros, <sense id="n49830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the unicorn</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Jud. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Off. Min. 2, 16, 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
unicorporeus: <entryFree id="n49831" type="hapax" key="u_ni^corpo^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭcorpŏrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unuscorpus</etym>, <sense id="n49831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having one body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">single-bodied</hi>: signum in caelo (taurus), Firm. Math. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
unicuba: <entryFree id="n49832" type="main" key="u_ni^cu^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭcŭba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>unus-cubo</etym>, <sense id="n49832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has lain with but one husband</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
unicultor: <entryFree id="n49833" type="hapax" key="u_ni^cultor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭ-cultor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>unus</etym>, <sense id="n49833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a worshipper of one God</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a monotheist</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 13, 90.</sense></entryFree>
unicus: <entryFree id="n49834" type="main" key="u_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one and no more</hi>, <hi rend="ital">only</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">single</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n49834.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of number: <cit><quote lang="la">tuus unicus gnatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1</bibl></cit>, <cb n="UNIG" /> 1, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">gnatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gnata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 3</bibl></cit>. 8; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 1, 73: filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 14, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid me patrem par facere'st, quoi ille'st unicus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 38</bibl></cit> (44): <cit><quote lang="la">filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:41:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 41, § 104</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 334</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:4:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 25, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anser erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:684" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 684</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:853" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 853</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancillula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 112, 6</bibl></cit>.—Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">unus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui me unum atque unicum amicum habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:73:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 73, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idque unum et prae omnibus unicum effice,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 156, 32</bibl></cit>.—By <hi rend="ital">solus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamlubet esto Unica res quaedam nativo corpore sola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 542</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unica solaque res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1078" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1078</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49834.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">spes unica imperii populi Romani, L. Quinctius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 26, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unicum doloris levamentum studia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis tutum praesidium, quod unicum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unicum afflictae mihi solamen hoc est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 703" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 703</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phoen. 89</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49834.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of nature, character, or quality, <hi rend="ital">alone of its kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncommon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unparalleled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unique</hi> (cf.: egregius, eminens): homo unica est natura ac singularia, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 491, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis tam ... ingenio unico? Afran. ap. Fest. s. v. sagaces, p. 321 Müll.: eximius imperator, unicus dux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 12, 13</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">imperator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir unicus in omni fortunā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 32, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 14, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectator caeli siderumque (Archimedes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 34, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultor Romanae ignominiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 15, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 454</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:239" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 239</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:531" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 531</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 12, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">2: mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4</bibl></cit>. 509: <cit><quote lang="la">concordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 33, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 21, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam tu poëta es prorsus ad eam rem unicus,</quote> <trans><tr>singularly fit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi ille unicu'st, mihi etiam unico magis unicus,</quote> <trans><tr>more than an orly one</tr>, <tr>more than a darling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49834.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">singularly bad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detestable</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">unica malitia atque nequitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:7:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: luxuria, Fest. s. v. Sardanapalus, p. 322 Müll.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">alone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singularly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in an extraordinary degree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem unice diligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eximie et unice delectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo ornamento P.Vergilius unice est usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus amator unice Vergilius fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid Tiridaten terreat, unice Securus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>utterly regardless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mammarum vitiis aizoum unice medetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 15, 92, § 163</bibl></cit>.—In Plaut. with <hi rend="ital">unus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me unice unum ex omnibus te atque illam amare aiebas mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immo unice unum plurimi pendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
unifinis: <entryFree id="n49835" type="main" key="u_ni^fi_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭ-fīnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unus</etym>, <sense id="n49835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">possessing the same termination</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uniformis: <entryFree id="n49836" type="main" key="u_ni^formis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭ-formis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unus-forma</etym>, <sense id="n49836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having only one shape</hi> or <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uniform</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">simplex quiddam et uniforme doceri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies deorum dearumque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 259, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanum genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Asclep. p. 98, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alimonia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">institutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 9" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 9</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.—Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭformĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in one and the same manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uniformly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Asclep. p. 77, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uniformitas: <entryFree id="n49837" type="main" key="u_ni^formi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭformĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>uniformis</etym>, <sense id="n49837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uniformity</hi> (opp. varietas; <cit><quote lang="la">post-class.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 5 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 212</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 17 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
uniformiter: <entryFree id="n49838" type="main" key="u_ni^formi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭformĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. uniformis, <sense id="n49838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
unigena: <entryFree id="n49839" type="main" key="u_ni^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">oenĭgĕ-nŏs</orth> <itype>unigenitus</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=195" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 195</bibl> Müll.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unus-gigno</etym>. <sense id="n49839.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Only-begotten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">only</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">idcirco singularem deus hunc mundum atque unigenam procreavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—In Christian authors, of Christ: <cit><quote lang="la">dominus deusque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 5, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. unigenitus.—</sense><sense id="n49839.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Born of one parent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of one</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the same family</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): te, Phoebe, relinquens Unigenamque simul cultricem montibus Idri, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Diana</hi>, sister of Phoebus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 301</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">Zephyrus</hi>, as brother of Memnon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 66, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
unigenitus: <entryFree id="n49840" type="main" key="u_ni^ge^ni^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭ-gĕnĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">onlybegotten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">only</hi> (eccl. Lat.; cf. unicus): unigenitus<cb n="UNIV" />  ille vocatur, qui parentibus solus sit, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Helv. 9</bibl>: filius, Tert. adv Gnost. 7; Aug. Civ. Dei, 11, 24; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan 1, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
unijugus: <entryFree id="n49841" type="main" key="u_ni^ju^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭ-jŭgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unus-jugum</etym>. <sense id="n49841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having one yoke</hi>: vinea, <hi rend="ital">fastened to a single yoke</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cross-beam.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49841.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22</bibl>. 35, § 183.—* </sense><sense id="n49841.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that has been married only once</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Joseph,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
unimammae: <entryFree id="n49842" type="main" key="u_ni^mammae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭmammae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <number>plur.</number> [unusmamma], <sense id="n49842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one-breasted</hi> women, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Amazons.</hi> Titian. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 9, 2, 64</bibl>; Auct. Itin. Alex. 41; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 3:50" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 3, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
unimanus: <entryFree id="n49843" type="main" key="u_ni^ma^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭmănus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unus-manus</etym> <sense id="n49843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having only one hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one-handed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49843.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">puer natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 21, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 21, 12</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n49843.2" n="II" level="1"> Unimanus, <hi rend="ital">the surname of a certain Claudius.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:17:16" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 17, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
unimodus: <entryFree id="n49844" type="main" key="u_ni^mo^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭmŏdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unus-modus</etym>. <sense id="n49844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of one fashion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simple</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">compages,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 768</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
uninomius: <entryFree id="n49845" type="main" key="u_ni^no_mi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭnōmĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unus-nomen</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">o(mw/numos</foreign>, <sense id="n49845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of one name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bearing the same name</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 1, 6, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
unio: <entryFree id="n49846" type="main" key="u_ni^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭo</orth>, <itype>ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>unus</etym>, <sense id="n49846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to join together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unite</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">conjungo): caelum mari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 17</bibl></cit>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 2, 43, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:15:section=13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 15, § 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 283, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49847" type="main" key="u_ni^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> and <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n49847.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fem</hi> </sense><sense id="n49847.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The number one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oneness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unity</hi> (eccl Lat.): decas decimā unione completur, Hier. in Amos, 2, 5, 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 4</bibl>; id Res. Carn. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n49847.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A unity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">union</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Maria Dei unione fecunda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep 22, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">18, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49847.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr. </sense><sense id="n49847.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a single large pearl</hi> (cf. margarita), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 56, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:122" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 35, 59, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:9:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:81:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 81, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:49:13" default="NO">12, 49, 13</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: Cleopatranae, Treb. XXX. Tyrann. 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n49847.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of single onion</hi> caepam, quam vocant unionem rustici. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 10, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uniola: <entryFree id="n49848" type="main" key="u_ni^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. unio</etym>, <sense id="n49848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plani</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
unionitae: <entryFree id="n49849" type="main" key="Uni^o^ni_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Unĭŏnītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Unionites</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Unitarians</hi>, a religious sect that denied the Trinity, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 246 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
unipetius: <entryFree id="n49850" type="hapax" key="u_ni^pe^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭpĕtĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unus-pes</etym>, <sense id="n49850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having only one stalk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urtica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 15 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
unistirpis: <entryFree id="n49851" type="hapax" key="u_nistirpis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnistirpis</orth>, e. <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unus-stirps</etym>, <sense id="n49851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having only one stem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trunk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:30:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 30, 54</bibl>. § 125.</sense></entryFree>
unitas: <entryFree id="n49852" type="main" key="u_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>unus</etym>, <sense id="n49852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the state of being one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oneness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49852.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: singularis numeri unitas. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linum duplex triplexve sic tortum. ut unitas in eo facta sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Monotes et Henotes, id est solitas et unitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alv ei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 9, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in unitatem coire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se implicantur et quasi unitatem faciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11</bibl></cit>. 3, 43.—</sense><sense id="n49852.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49852.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sameness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uniformity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si alterum horum diceretur Priamus alterum Hecuba, nullam unitatem assignificaret, quae apparet in lego et legi et in Priamus et Priamo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 3</bibl></cit> Müll; <cit><quote lang="la">foliorum unitas in suo cuique genere permanet, praeterquam populo, hederae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 22, 35, § 85</bibl></cit>: in unitatem venit equester ordo, <hi rend="ital">are brought under one name</hi> (that of Equites), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 2, 8, § 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49852.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unity of sentiment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concord</hi> virtutes ibi esse debebunt, ubi consensus atque unitas erit: <cit><quote lang="la">dissident vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 8:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 8, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
uniter: <entryFree id="n49853" type="main" key="u_ni^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">into one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">together in one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conjointly</hi>, = in unum (Lucretian): <cit><quote lang="la">cum corporis atque animaï Discidium fuerit, quibus e sumus uniter apti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:839" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 839</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:846" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 846</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:555" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 555</bibl>; 5, 558: cedere, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:298" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 298</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uniusmodi: <entryFree id="n49854" type="main" key="u_ni_^usmo^di"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnī^usmŏdi</orth>, v. unus, I. B. 1.</entryFree>
universalis: <entryFree id="n49855" type="main" key="u_ni^versa_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭversālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>universus</etym>, <sense id="n49855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to all</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">universal</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta universalia vel perpetualia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:12" default="NO">3, 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil inveniebam aut proprium aut universale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:71:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 71, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
universaliter: <entryFree id="n49856" type="main" key="u_ni^versa_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭversālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>universalis</etym>, <sense id="n49856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">all together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si grex venierit universaliter uno pretio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:35" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
universatim: <entryFree id="n49857" type="hapax" key="u_ni^versa_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭversātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>universus</etym>, <sense id="n49857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">al</hi> <pb n="1933" /> <cb n="UNIV" /> <hi rend="ital">together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wholly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entirely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consecrare aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
universe: <entryFree id="n49858" type="main" key="u_ni^verse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭversē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. universus <sense id="n49858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
universim: <entryFree id="n49859" type="main" key="u_ni^versim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭversim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>universus</etym>, <sense id="n49859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">all together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as a whole</hi> (ante- and post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:Bell. Pun. 3:7" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> Bell. Pun. 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">generibus rerum summatim universimque utitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:22" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
universitas: <entryFree id="n49860" type="main" key="u_ni^versi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭversĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the whole.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49860.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">universitas generis humani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:65:164" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 65, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in universitate rerum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in the universe</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communem rerum naturam universitatemque omnia continentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 39</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc interdictum ad universitatem bonorum, non ad singulas res pertinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 41, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:23" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 41, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tantum universitati ejus attendas, verum etiam particulas persequaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 3:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 15, 5</bibl>: res per universitatem adquirere, <hi rend="ital">in the aggregate</hi>, of succession to the entire property of a person, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 97 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:3:1:section=13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 3, 1, § 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49860.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr. </sense><sense id="n49860.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The whole number of things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the whole world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the universe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">universitatis corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">volubilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 5, 4, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitus terrae totius ad magnitudinem universitatis instar obtuet puncti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49860.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A number of persons associated into one body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a society</hi>, <hi rend="ital">company</hi>, <hi rend="ital">community</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corporation</hi>, etc. (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">universitatis sunt, non singulorum, veluti quae in civitatibus sunt theatra et stadia et similia et siqua alia sunt communia civitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: quae (res) publicae sunt nullius in bonis creduntur, ipsius enim universitatis esse creduntur, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cujusque universitatis nomine vel contra eam agetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:4:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de libertis universitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 38</bibl></cit>, tit. 3; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
universus: <entryFree id="n49861" type="main" key="u_ni^versus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭversus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> contr., unvorsum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 262</bibl>; <number>plur.</number> OINVORSEI, S. C. Bacch.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unus-verto, turned into one, combined into one whole</etym>, <sense id="n49861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">all together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all taken collectively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collective</hi>, <hi rend="ital">general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">universal</hi> (opp. singuli). </sense><sense id="n49861.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">universa provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:69:section=168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 69, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:20:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 20, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:34:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 34, 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">universum mundum complecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:43:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 43, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:39:2" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triduum,</quote> <trans><tr>three days together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium tantum ac tam universum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 27, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confusa atque universa defensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">universa et propria oratoris vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:15:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 15, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de universā philosophiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimicatio,</quote> <trans><tr>a general engagement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 32, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 12, 9</bibl></cit>.—Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">totus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupus Gregem universum voluit totum avortere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 134</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49861.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de universis generibus rerum dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 17, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex iis rebus universis eloquentia constat, quibus in singulis elaborare permagnum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eadem sit utilitas uniuscujusque et universorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (virtus) etiam populos universos tueri soleat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 14, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illum universi tela coniciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Democritus) ita sit ausus ordiri: haec loquor de universis. Nihil excipit, de quo non profiteatur: quid enim esse potest extra universa?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 73</bibl></cit>.—Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">omnes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id genus hominum omnibus Universis est adversum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talibus dictis universi omnes assensere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 189</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49861.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49861.4" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭversi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the whole body</hi> of citizens, <hi rend="ital">all men</hi> together: <cit><quote lang="la">cum crudelitate unius oppressi essent universi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:31:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 31, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et earum urbium separatim ab universis singulos diligunt (di),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:66:165" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 66, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si universi videre optimum et in eo consentire possent, nihil opus esset pluribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 34, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49861.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭversum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the whole world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the universe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum censet imagines divinitate praeditas inesse in universitate rerum: tum principia mentis, quae sunt in eodem universo, deos esse dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:43:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 43, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitor universi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49861.6" n="2" level="3"> Adverb.: in universum, <hi rend="ital">as a whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generally</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">non nominatim, sed in universum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 26, 8</bibl></cit>: terra etsi aliquando specie differt, in universum tamen aut silvis<cb n="UNUS" />  horrida aut paludibus foeda, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 5</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 19, § 50</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭversē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generally</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnmo, generatim, communiter): singillatim potius quam generatim atque universe loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:55:section=143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 55, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera universe mandavi: illud proprie, ne pateretur prorogari nobis provincias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 268</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
univira: <entryFree id="n49862" type="main" key="u_ni^vi^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭvĭra</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭvĭrĭa</orth>, Treb. XXX. Tyrann. 32; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 307, 3</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>unusvir</etym>, <sense id="n49862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a woman that has had only one husband</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhort. ad Castit. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1, 11</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">univira viduitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Psych. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
univiratus: <entryFree id="n49863" type="main" key="u_ni^vi^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭvĭrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <etym>univira</etym>, <sense id="n49863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the state</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition of a woman who has married but once</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhort. ad Castit. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Uxor. 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
univiria: <entryFree id="n49864" type="main" key="u_ni^vi^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭvĭrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. univira.</entryFree>
univocus: <entryFree id="n49865" type="main" key="u_ni^vo^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnĭvŏcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unus-vox</etym>, <sense id="n49865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has but one meaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">univocal</hi> (logical t. t.): <cit><quote lang="la">univocis aequivoca conectere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 339</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, § 356</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uno: <entryFree id="n49866" type="hapax" key="u_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>unus</etym>, <sense id="n49866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to join</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dividere potius quam unare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
unoculus: <entryFree id="n49867" type="main" key="u_no^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnŏcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>unus-oculus</etym>, <sense id="n49867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one-eyed</hi>: Cyclops, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:11:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 11, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens (Arimaspi),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 15</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.—Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnŏcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a one-eyed person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 22</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
unomammia: <entryFree id="n49868" type="main" key="U_no^mammi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ūnŏmammĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>unus-mamma</etym>, <sense id="n49868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Single-breasted land</hi>, a comically - formed name to denote the country of the Amazons, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
unose: <entryFree id="n49869" type="main" key="u_no_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>unus</etym>, <sense id="n49869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">at once</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the same time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">together</hi>, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 183, 21</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 213 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
unquam: <entryFree id="n49870" type="main" key="unquam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">unquam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. umquam.</entryFree>
unus: <entryFree id="n49871" type="main" key="u_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnus</orth> (old forms OINOS and OENOS; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 9</bibl>; C. I. L. 1, 32, 35), a, um (scanned <sense id="n49871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> unĭus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 379</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 13 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unīus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 251</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:181 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 181 al.</bibl>; ante-class. collat. form of the <hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> uni, Titin. ap. Prisc. pp. 694 and 717 P.; <hi rend="ital">dat. m.</hi> uno, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:18:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 18, 6</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">dat. f.</hi> unae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 19, 1</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> OINO, C. I. L. <hi rend="ital">l. l.; voc.</hi> une, Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 673</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:37:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 37, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=63" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 63</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 1:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 1, 7</bibl>), <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">oi)/nh, oi)=os;</foreign> Goth. ains; Germ. eins; Engl. one</etym>. </sense><sense id="n49871.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n49871.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a single.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49871.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dabitur tibi amphora una et una semita, Fons unus, unum aënum et octo dolia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:33 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 33 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres duas pejores esse quam unam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluris est oculatus testis unus, quam auriti decem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unius esse negotium diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors Tiberii Gracchi ... divisit populum unum in duas partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 19, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum penes unum est omnium summa rerum, regem illum unum vocamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui uno et octogesimo anno scribens est mortuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 141</bibl>.—Corresponding to <hi rend="ital">alter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Helvetii continentur unā ex parte flumine Rheno, alterā ex parte monte Jurā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum, alterum, tertium annum Sassia quiescebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 64, 178</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:29:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 29, § 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 29, § 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercituum unus ... alter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 44, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio triplex: una de vitā et moribus, altera de naturā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum duas cerneret vias, unam Voluptatis, alteram Virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 32, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unam Nicaeam, alteram Bucephalen vocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:8:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 8, 8</bibl></cit>; and, connected with <hi rend="ital">alter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habetur una atque altera contio vehemens,</quote> <trans><tr>repeated</tr>, <tr>several</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 28, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque in uno aut altero animadversum est, sed jam in pluribus,</quote> <trans><tr>one or two</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:21:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 21, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meae verecundiae sufficit unus aut alter, ac potius unus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 13</bibl></cit>. 3; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 3, 1: excepto patre tuo, praeterea uno aut altero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus atque alter et mox plures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus et alter assentiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:7:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed postquam amans accessit ... Unus et item alter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1</bibl></cit>. 50: <cit><quote lang="la">amici, Qui modo de multis unus et alter erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:16" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">rarely unus post unum (= singuli deinceps): interiere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 26:41" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 26, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno plus Tuscorum cecidisse in acie (sc. quam Romanorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">legem unā plures tribus antiquarunt quam jusserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 30, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.4" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. part.</hi>: Gallia est omnis divisa in partes tres: quarum unam incolunt Belgae,<cb n="UNUS" />  aliam, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam philosophiam tres in partes diviserunt ... quarum cum una sit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superiores tres erant, quarum est una sola defensa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orare ut trium harum rerum unam ab se impetrari sinerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 23, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex unis geminas mihi conficies nuptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: molas asinarias unas, et trusatiles unas, Hispanienses unas. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 4</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">molae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrigae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similitudines, unae rerum, alterae verborum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 20, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adductus sum tuis unis et alteris litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decumae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:98:section=227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 98, § 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi invideo, quod unis vestimentis tam diu lautus es,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 29, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis una superque Vidimus excidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 642</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:548" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 548</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.6" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tria Graecorum genera sunt, quorum uni sunt Athenienses, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 27, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.7" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n49871.8" n="1" level="3"> Adverbial expressions. </sense><sense id="n49871.9" n="a" level="4"> Ad unum, <hi rend="ital">all together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unanimously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to a man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without exception</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplius duūm milium numero ad unum terga vertebant, Auct. B. Afr. 70: consurrexit senatus cum clamore ad unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter, si nondum exosus ad unum Trojanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:687" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 687</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui sunt adsensi ad unum (senatores),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsos ad unum caedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:32" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5, 32</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">usu. with omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 42, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 27</bibl>; cf. ad, C. 2.— </sense><sense id="n49871.10" n="b" level="4"> In unum, <hi rend="ital">into one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to one place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fibrenus divisus aequaliter in duas partes latera haec alluit, rapideque dilapsus cito in unum confluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 51:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 51, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 673</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.11" n="2" level="3"> Of that which is common to several persons or things, <hi rend="ital">one and the same.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49871.12" n="a" level="4"> Alone. </sense><sense id="n49871.13" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum suo sibi gnato unam ad amicam de die Potare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno exemplo ne omnes vitam viverent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 132</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. prol. 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unius aetatis clarissimi et sapientissimi nostrae civitatis viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa cum uno tempore audīsset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque uno etiam tempore accidit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus hic erit unus honos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 308</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes una manet nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus utrique Error,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentum injuriae Unius modi sunt ferme,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli putare tolerabiles horum insanias nec unius modi fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">unius modi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 7</bibl></cit>.—Esp., uno ore, <hi rend="ital">with one voice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unanimously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteri amici omnes Uno ore auctores fuere, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de cujus utilitate omnes uno ore consentiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unoque omnes eadem ore fremebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 132</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.14" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aderit una in unis aedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unis moribus et nunquam mutatis legibus vivunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 26, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.15" n="b" level="4"> Connected with <hi rend="ital">idem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitus quidem omnium unus et idem fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:47:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 47, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quā (sc. causā) omnes sentirent unum atque idem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferar unus et idem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 200</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 14, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.16" n="c" level="4"> Corresponding to <hi rend="ital">idem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non semper idem floribus est honor Vernis, neque uno Luna rubens nitet Vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 11, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.17" n="3" level="3"> For solus, of that which is alone, by itself; <hi rend="ital">one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">only</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">single.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49871.18" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49871.19" n="(a)" level="5"> Alone: <cit><quote lang="la">hic unus, ut ego suspicor, servat fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum hoc scio, hanc meritam esse, ut memor esses sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 46</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">unum hoc definio, tantam esse necessitatem virtutis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum mihi sit unum opus hoc a parentibus meis relictum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 22, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc vero eversis omnibus rebus, una ratio videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque unum illud erat insitum priscis illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quove praesidio unus per tot gentes pervenisset?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat omnino in Galliā ulteriore legio una,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompejus plus potest unus, quam ceteri omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (sc. mihi) semper uni magis, quam universis, placere voluisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:16:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 16, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (sc. Demosthenes) unus eminet inter omnes in omni genere dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:29:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 29, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te unum in tanto exercitu mihi fuisse adsensorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 21, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Antonio nihil dico praeter unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.20" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum te unum ex omnibus ad dicendum maxime natum aptumque cognōssem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 99</bibl></cit>: illc unus ex omnibus Italicis intactus profugit,<pb n="1934" /> <cb n="UNSU" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 67:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 67, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:69:4" default="NO" valid="yes">69, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.21" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille unus ordinis nostri discessu meo palam exsultavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:64:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 64, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod post Cannensem cladem unus Romanorum imperatorum prospere rem gessisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:30:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 30, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.22" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu, quam ego unam vidi mulierem audacissumam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus istic servos est sacerrumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem unam esse omnium difficillimam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:6:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem unam mihi amicissimam declinavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 41, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo ego uno equite Romano familiarissime utor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:43:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 43, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virum unum totius Graeciae doctissimum Platonem accepimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab.
