Post. 9, 23</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">magis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam Juno fertur terris magis omnibus unam Posthabitā coluisse Samo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagacius unus odoror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:4" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 4</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">solus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus est solus inventus, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:62:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 62, 130</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:5:section=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 5, § 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex uno oppido solo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 75</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">185: nil admirari prope res est una, Numici, Solaque, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te unum, solum suum depeculatorem, vexatorem ... venisse senserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 40, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus solusque censebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:76" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 76</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">tantum</hi> (rare before the Aug. age; once in Cic.; cf. Halm ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:22:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 22, 62</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">inter bina castra ... unum flumen tantum intererat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excepit unum tantum, nihil amplius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unius tantum criminis in vincla te duci jubeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 56, 4</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">unā tantum perforatā navi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:50:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 50, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:43:6" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 43, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 79:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 79, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:131" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 47, § 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 14</bibl>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum defuisse tantum superbiae, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 16, 5</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">i</foreign>) Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">modo</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nam aliis unus modo, aliis plures, aliis omnes eidem videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:54:180" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 54, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi unum modo quale sit suspicantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc autem si ita sit, ut unum modo sensibus falsum videtur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 32, 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 89:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 89, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 61, 12</bibl> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:45:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 45, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 42, 5</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">k</foreign>) Unus for unus omnium maxime: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tibi una in amore atque in deliciis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:1:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Nautes, unum Tritonia Pallas Quem docuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 704</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">l</foreign>) Emphat., with negatives, <hi rend="ital">no one</hi> person or thing, <hi rend="ital">not a single one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">none whatever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum si reddis mihi, praeterea unum nummum ne duis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo de nobis unus excellat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:36:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 36, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut unum signum Byzantii ex maximo numero nullum haberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā re unā magis oratorem commendari, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:59:216" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 59, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec adhortatio praetoris non modo quemquam unum elicuit ad suadendum, sed ne fremitum quidem movit (i. e. non modo non ... sed),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia nemo unus satis dignus regno visus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo mortuo ad neminem unum summa imperii redit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodiis ut nihil unum insigne, ita omnis generis dona dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 20, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:45:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 45, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.23" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequere me Tres unos passus,</quote> <trans><tr>three single steps</tr>, <tr>only three steps</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unae quinque minae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruri dum sum ego unos sex dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 129</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese unis Suebis concedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ubii, qui uni legatos miserant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut unis litteris totius aestatis res gestas ad senatum perscriberem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abs te ipso, qui me accusas, unas mihi scito litteras redditas esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n49871.24" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">indef.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a</hi> or <hi rend="ital">an</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">some</hi>, <hi rend="ital">some one.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49871.25" n="A" level="2"> Without a <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49871.26" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter mulieres, Quae ibi aderant, forte unam aspicio adulescentulam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi una aderit mulier lepida, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut unus paterfamilias his de rebus loquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:29:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 29, 132</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">me una haec res torquet, quod non Pompejum tanquam unus manipularis secutus sim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.27" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut me sic audiatis ut unum e togatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:22:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 22, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non fuit orator unus e multis: potius inter multos prope singularis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:274" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 79, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex principibus unus nomine Polyaenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus ex ultimā turbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 27, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.28" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis L. Verginius unusque de multis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 66</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49871.29" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. part.</hi> (not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">eregione unius eorum pontium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollonides principum unus orationem habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastorum unus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10</bibl></cit>, <cb n="URAN" /> 4, 8: <cit><quote lang="la">servus unus exulum initium fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 23, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scortum transfugarum unius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 12, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:33:11" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 33, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:42:30" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 42, 30</bibl>; 37, 23, 7; <cit><quote lang="la">40, 5, 10: unus turbae militaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:42:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 42, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 40, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus hostium Latinae linguae sciens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">una Amazonum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum se civium (esse) respondit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.30" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est huic unus servos violentissimus, Qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tanquam mihi cum M. Crasso contentio esset, non cum uno gladiatore nequissimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.31" n="B" level="2"> With, </sense><sense id="n49871.32" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quibus si unum aliquod in te cognoveris, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 9, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad unum aliquem confugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 12, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unius alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:24:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 24, § 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 3, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 1, 3</bibl>.—In the order aliquis unus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 32, 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.33" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Quidam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est enim eloquentia una quaedam de summis virtutibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unius cujusdam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.34" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Quivis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tu solus aut quivis unus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:22:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 22, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.35" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Quilibet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">queratur unus quilibet militis mei injuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 42, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus Quiritium quilibet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 40, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quilibet unus ex iis, quos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 17, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.36" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Quisque</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponite ante oculos unum quemque regum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:2:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">unus quisque (and sometimes in one word, unusquisque): unāquāque de re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum quodque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum quidque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:59:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 59, § 132</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domini capitis unius cujusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 32, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.37" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Quisquis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin unum quicquid singillatim et placide percontabere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum quicquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1388</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49871.38" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Private</hi>, <hi rend="ital">un official</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a private person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a private citizen</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dicentes publicam violationem fidei non debere unius lui sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro uno homine jactura publica pacisceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 7:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnā</orth> (acc. to I. B. 1.), <hi rend="ital">in one and the same place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the same time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in company</hi>, <hi rend="ital">together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum Amphitruone hinc una ieram in exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic Juppiter hodie ipse aget, Et ego una cum illo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> prol. 95: <cit><quote lang="la">quod summi puerorum amores saepe una cum praetextā togā ponerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">i mecum, obsecro, una simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandata eri perierunt, una et Sosia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mei consilii causam rationemque cognoverit, una et id quod facio probabit, et, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui una venerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum et ego essem una et pauci admodum familiares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in Italiā consistat (Pompejus), erimus una,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:24:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 24, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 21, 81</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pallas huic filius una, Una omnes juvenum primi pauperque senatus Tura dabant,</quote> <trans><tr>at the same time</tr>, <tr>along with him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:104 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 104 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
unusquisque: <entryFree id="n49872" type="main" key="u_nusquisque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūnusquisque</orth>, v. unus, II. B. 5.</entryFree>
unxia: <entryFree id="n49873" type="main" key="Unxia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Unxia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ungo</etym>, <sense id="n49873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of anointing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 115</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 227</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
upilio: <entryFree id="n49874" type="main" key="u_pi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūpĭlĭo</orth> (eollat. form of ōpĭlĭo, q. v.), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ovis</etym>, <sense id="n49874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shepherd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 279, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
upis: <entryFree id="n49875" type="main" key="Upis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Upis</orth>, is. <sense id="n49875.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the father of the third Diana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49875.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the third Diana; acc.</hi> Upim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
upupa: <entryFree id="n49876" type="main" key="upu^pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">upŭpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">e)/poy</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n49876.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a hoopoe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 44, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:73" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 25, 36, § 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=75" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 75</bibl> Müll.; cf. epops.—</sense><sense id="n49876.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of hoe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mattock</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
urascorpiu: <entryFree id="n49877" type="greek" key="u_ra scorpiu"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūra scorpiu</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">ou)ra\ skorpi/ou</foreign>, <sense id="n49877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scorpion's-tail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uraeus: <entryFree id="n49878" type="greek" key="u_raeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūraeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">ou)rai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n49878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the tail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cybia,</quote> <trans><tr>tail-pieces of tunny-fish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 151</bibl></cit> (dub.; Jahn, terna cybia); cf. uraeon = <foreign lang="greek">ou)rai=on</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">fishtail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=77" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 77</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
urania: <entryFree id="n49879" type="main" key="U_ra^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ūrănĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ūrănĭē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ou)rani/a</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*ou)rani/h</foreign> (the Heavenly), <sense id="n49879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Urania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Muse of astronomy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:11:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 11, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:55" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 20, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1</bibl>, §§ 7 and 28; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 161" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 161</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49879.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of one of Actœon's hounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 181" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uranoscopus: <entryFree id="n49880" type="greek" key="u_ra^nosco^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūrănoscŏpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <sense id="n49880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">m</hi> = <foreign lang="greek">ou)ranosko/pos</foreign> (the heaven-gazer), <hi rend="ital">a sea-fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> callionymus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 24, § 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:146" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uranus: <entryFree id="n49881" type="main" key="U_ra^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ūrănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ou)rano/s</foreign>, <sense id="n49881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of</hi> <cb n="URBA" /> <hi rend="ital">Saturn</hi> (pure Lat. Caelus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 11, § 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 13, § 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
urbanatim: <entryFree id="n49882" type="main" key="urba_na_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">urbānātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>urbanus</etym>, <sense id="n49882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">after the manner of city people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">politely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urbanely</hi>: at ego rusticatim tangam, urbanatim nescio, Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 409, 2</bibl>, and 166, 31.</sense></entryFree>
urbane: <entryFree id="n49883" type="main" key="urba_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">urbānē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. urbanus <sense id="n49883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
urbanicianus: <entryFree id="n49884" type="main" key="urba_ni^ci^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">urbānĭcĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>urbanus</etym>; in milit. lang., <sense id="n49884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">garrisoned in the city</hi> (of Rome): <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:6:35:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 6, 35, § 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Carac. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Get. 6</bibl> (called urbanae cohor tes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:1:8:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 25, 1, 8, § 9</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
urbanitas: <entryFree id="n49885" type="main" key="urba_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">urbānĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a living in a city</hi>, <hi rend="ital">city life.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49885.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">desideria urbis et urbanitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in urbis urbanitatisque desiderio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49885.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">city fashion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">city manners</hi>, both in a good and in a bad sense. </sense><sense id="n49885.3" n="A" level="2"> In a good sense. </sense><sense id="n49885.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Refinement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegance of manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">politeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courtesy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affability</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urbanity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">addo urbanitatem, quae est virtus, ut Stoici rectissime putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49885.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Refinement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delicacy</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">elegance</hi> of speech: <cit><quote lang="la">urbanitate quādam quasi colorata oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:170" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 46, 170</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 17</bibl> (opp. rusticitas); 6, 3, 103 sq.—</sense><sense id="n49885.6" n="b" level="4"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">wit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasantry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raillery</hi>: contumelia si petulantius jactatur, convicium; <cit><quote lang="la">si facetius, urbanitas nominatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quantam hominum facetorum urbanitatem incurratis, non dico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aliquando subtilitatem veteris urbanitatis et humanissimi sermonis attingerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vides exaruisse jam veterem urbanitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mancipiorum urbanitas in dominos contumeliosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 11:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in jocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risus si aptus est, urbanitatis nomen adsequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:115" default="NO">10, 1, 115</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49885.7" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">trickery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roguery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knavery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incuriosos milites (vernaculā utebantur urbanitate) quidam spoliavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 88</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vernula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
urbanus: <entryFree id="n49886" type="main" key="urba_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">urbānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>urbs</etym>, <sense id="n49886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city</hi> or <hi rend="ital">town</hi>, <hi rend="ital">city-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">town-</hi> (opp. rusticus; cf.: urbicus, oppidanus). </sense><sense id="n49886.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49886.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri majores non sine causā praeponebant rusticos Romanos urbanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: rustica et urbana vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita (opp. rustica),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbani assidui cives, quos scurras vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scurra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 37, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">administratio rei publicae (opp. provincialis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:15:section=43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 15, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 44</bibl></cit>: praedia, <hi rend="ital">land and houses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all land covered by buildings</hi> (v. praedium), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:198" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:1:1" default="NO">8, 1, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 8</bibl>, tit. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:1:8:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 25, 1, 8, § 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49886.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">urbā-nus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of a city</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a city man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">citizen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbani fiunt rustici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:3:15 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 3, 15 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes urbani, rustici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:23:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 23, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo omnis non modo urbanorum, sed etiam rusticorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:24:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 24, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obrepere urbanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49886.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">devoted to the city</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fond of city life</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligere secessum, quem tu nimis urbanus es, nisi concupiscis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49886.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">in the city fashion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the city style</hi>, <hi rend="ital">citizenlike</hi>, both in a good and a bad sense. </sense><sense id="n49886.6" n="A" level="2"> In a good sense. </sense><sense id="n49886.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Polished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cultivated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courteous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urbane</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">comis, humanus): hominem non solum sapientem, verum etiam, ut nunc loquimur urbanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:34 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 34 sq.</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:6:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 6, § 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49886.8" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants, <hi rend="ital">improved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cultivated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornamental</hi>: sunt arborum quaedam urbaniores, quas his placet nominibus distinguere. Hae mites, quae fructu atque aliqua dote umbrarumve officio humaniusjuvant, non improbe dicantur urbanae. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 19, 32, § 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acanthi topiariae et urbanae herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 22, 34, § 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49886.9" n="2" level="3"> Of speech. </sense><sense id="n49886.10" n="a" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">refined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegant. nice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vocibus nostrorum oratorum recinit quiddam et resonat urbanius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:171" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 46, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os facile, explanatum, jucundum, urbanum, id est, in quo nulla neque rusticitas neque peregrinitas resonet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">distinctior et urbanior et altior Cicero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49886.11" n="b" level="4"> In <pb n="1935" /> <cb n="URBS" /> partic., of wit, <hi rend="ital">witty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">facetious</hi>: urbanus homo erit, cujus multa bene dicta responsaque erunt: et qui in sermonibus, circulis, conviviis, item in contionibus, omni denique loco ridicule commodeque dicet, Domit. Mars. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:105" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum per se urbanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumfertur Marcii Philippi velut urbanissimum factum atque dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui est in isto genere urbanissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani veteres atque urbani sales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines lauti et urbani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:6:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tibi comis et urbanus liberque videtur,</quote> <trans><tr>witty</tr>, <tr>clever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbanus coepit haberi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in senatu dicax et urbanus et bellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbanos qui illa censuerunt dicam an miseros? Dicerem urbanos, si senatum deceret urbanitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 8:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49886.12" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">bold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontis ad urbanae descendi praemia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">urbānē</orth> (acc. to II. A.). </sense><sense id="n49886.13" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Courteously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">civilly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">politely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urbanely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">severe et graviter et prisce agere, an remisse ac leniter et urbane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbanius agere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 36</bibl></cit>: urbanissime et prudentissime adjuvit, Treb. Gallien. 14.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n49886.14" n="2" level="3"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">wittily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acutely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">happily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem facete et urbane ridere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene et urbane dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:26" default="NO">5, 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:46 al" default="NO">6, 1, 46 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:126" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emendare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbanius elabi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbanissime respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
urbicapus: <entryFree id="n49887" type="hapax" key="urbi^ca^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">urbĭcăpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>urbs-capio</etym>, <sense id="n49887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city taker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taker of cities</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbicape, occisor regum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
urbicarius: <entryFree id="n49888" type="main" key="urbi^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">urbĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>urbicus</etym>, <sense id="n49888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">regiones, Cod. Th. 11, 28, 14: praefectura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 24, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
urbicremus: <entryFree id="n49889" type="hapax" key="urbi^cre^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">urbĭcrĕmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>urbs-cremo</etym>, <sense id="n49889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">city burning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes (of the destruction of Sodom),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 729</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
urbicus: <entryFree id="n49890" type="main" key="urbi^cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">urbĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>urbs</etym>, <sense id="n49890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city</hi>, <hi rend="ital">city-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">civic</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">res rusticae et urbicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negociatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:54:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 54, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:8:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49891" type="main" key="Urbi^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Urbĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a poet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:71" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:42:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 42, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
urbigenuspagus: <entryFree id="n49892" type="main" key="Urbigenus pa_gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Urbigenus pāgus</orth>, <sense id="n49892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a canton in Helvetia</hi>, perh. the mod. <hi rend="ital">Orbe</hi>, in Vaud, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 403</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
urbinum: <entryFree id="n49893" type="main" key="Urbi_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Urbīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n49893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Umbria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3714</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Urbīnas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Urbinum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Petissius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 8, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=84" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 84</bibl> Müll.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Urbī-nātes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Urbinum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 114</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 999</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
urbius: <entryFree id="n49894" type="main" key="Urbi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Urbĭus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Orbĭus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=182" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 182</bibl> Müll.) clivus, <sense id="n49894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in Rome on the Esquiline Hill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1, § 25</bibl>; cf. Becker, Antiq. 1, p. 525; and Müll. ad Fest. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
urbs: <entryFree id="n49895" type="main" key="urbs"><orth extent="full" lang="la">urbs</orth>, <itype>urbis</itype> (<case>dat.</case> VRBEI, Corp. Inscr. Lat. 206), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. vardh-, to make strong; cf. Pers. vard-ana, city</etym>, <sense id="n49895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a walled town</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a city.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49895.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49895.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">hi coetus sedem primum certo loco domiciliorum causā constituerunt: quam cum locis manuque sepsissent, ejusmodi conjunctionem tectorum oppidum vel urbem appellaverunt, delubris distinctam spatiisque communibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 26, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">post ea qui fiebat orbis, urbis principium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=143" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 143</bibl></cit> Müll.: urbs dicitur ab orbe, quod antiquae civitates in orbem flebant, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interea Aeneas urbem designat aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:755" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 755</bibl></cit> Serv.: <cit><quote lang="la">veni Syracusas, quod ab eā urbe ... quae tamen urbs, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: certabant urbem Romam Remoramne vocarent, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl> (Ann. v. 85 Vahl.): arce et urbe sum orba, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl> (Trag. v. 114 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">urbes magnae et imperiosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs illa praeclara (Syracusae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 31, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duabus urbibus eversis inimicissimis huic imperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>.— Rarely, and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, with the name of the city in <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs Patavi, Buthroti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 247</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 293</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cassius in oppido Antiochiae cum omni exercitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">adj. prop.</hi>: urbs Romana = <cb n="URGE" /> Roma, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 41, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:37:12" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 37, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:36:14" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 36, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:13:21" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 13, 21</bibl>.—Of other cities (rare and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Lampsacenae urbis salus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>, ext. 4: in urbe Aquilejensi, Paul. v. S. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs urbium,</quote> <trans><tr>a metropolis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:35" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49895.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the city of Rome</hi> (like <foreign lang="greek">a)/stu</foreign>, of Athens): <cit><quote lang="la">postquam Urbis appellationem, etiamsi nomen proprium non adiceretur, Romam tamen accipi sit receptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:103" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 103</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:9" default="NO">8, 5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus urbis condendae principium profectum a Romulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 47, 71</bibl>; 1, 1, 1; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 37, 58: (Caesar) maturat ab urbe proficisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de urbe augendā quid sit promulgatum, non intellexi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conditor urbis (Romulus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(pater) Dextera sacras jaculatus arces Terruit urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minatus urbi vincla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 9, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also urbs aeterna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.— Ad urbem esse, <hi rend="ital">to stop at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">near Rome;</hi> in publicists' lang., of returning generals, who had to remain outside of the city till the Senate decreed them the right of entrance; <cit><quote lang="la">or of provincial magistrates who were preparing for departure to their provinces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 15, 45</bibl></cit> Ascon.; 2, 2, 6, § 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 30, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 6, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49895.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as in Engl. </sense><sense id="n49895.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The city</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">the citizens</hi> (rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">civitas): invadunt urbem somno vinoque sepultam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maesta attonitaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:198" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 198</bibl></cit>: bene moratae, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49895.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The capital city</hi>, <hi rend="ital">metropolis</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si tam vicinum urbi municipium sit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 14, 1, 3.—* </sense><sense id="n49895.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem philosophiae, mihi crede, proditis, dum castella defenditis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the main point</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
urceatim: <entryFree id="n49896" type="hapax" key="urce^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">urcĕātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>urceus</etym>, <sense id="n49896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with pitchers</hi>: Jovem aquam exorabant: itaque statim urceatim pluebat, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in pailfuls</hi> (as we say), <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
urceolaris: <entryFree id="n49897" type="main" key="urce^o^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">urcĕŏlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> [urceolus), <sense id="n49897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to pitchers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pitcher-</hi>: herba, a plant used for polishing glass pitchers, <hi rend="ital">pellitory of the wall</hi>: Parietaria officinalis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 17, 20, § 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 39" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
urceolus: <entryFree id="n49898" type="main" key="urce^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">urcĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>urceus</etym>, <sense id="n49898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little pitcher</hi> or <hi rend="ital">water-pot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:16:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:203" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 203</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:64" default="NO">10, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:105" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 105</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
urceus: <entryFree id="n49899" type="main" key="urce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">urcĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n49899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ur-cĕum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 13, 1</bibl>) [Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u)/rxa</foreign>, a jar; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">orca],</quote> <trans><tr>a pitcher</tr>, <tr>water-pot</tr>, <tr>ewer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:18:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 18, § 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 18</bibl>; Cn. Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:24:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 24, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 24, § 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:56:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 56, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32:16 al" default="NO">12, 32, 16 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
uredo: <entryFree id="n49900" type="main" key="u_re_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūrēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>uro</etym>. <sense id="n49900.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A blast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blight</hi> of plants, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:35:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 35, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 69, § 279</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:20:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 20, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49900.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A burning itch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 45, 68, § 147</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 215, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
urethra: <entryFree id="n49901" type="main" key="u_re_thra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūrēthra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ou)rh/qra</foreign>, <sense id="n49901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the excretory canal of the urine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the urethra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:4:66" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 4, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:5:10:91" default="NO">5, 10, 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ureticus: <entryFree id="n49902" type="main" key="u_re_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūrētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">ou)rhtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n49902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to urine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urinary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:16" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
urgens: <entryFree id="n49903" type="main" key="urgens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">urgens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of urgeo.</entryFree>
urgeo: <entryFree id="n49904" type="main" key="urgeo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">urgeo</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">urgueo</orth>), <itype>ursi</itype> (<sense id="n49904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> rare; <hi rend="ital">past part.</hi> not found), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">verg-, ei(/rgnumi</foreign>, to shut in; Sanscr. varg-, vargami, prevent; Germ. Merk; Engl. work</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to press</hi>, <hi rend="ital">push</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urge.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49904.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: pello, trudo): unda impellitur undā Urgeturque eadem veniens urgetque priorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urgeris turbā circum te stante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angustoque vagos pisces urgere catino,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidique pedem pede fervidus urget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:748" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 748</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 20, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut petis aut urges ruiturum, Sisyphe, saxum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>roll up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versaque in obnixos urguentur cornua vasto Cum gemitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres (naves) Eurus ab alto In brevia et Syrtes urget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserum tenues in jecur urget acus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites in oppidum, Auct. B. Afr. 6, 3: (Mars) aetherias currus urgebat ad arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:222" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 222</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49904.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49904.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To press upon</hi> (as something burdensome or compulsory). </sense><sense id="n49904.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To bear hard</hi> or <hi rend="ital">close upon; press hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beset</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar cum septimam legionem, quae juxta constiterat, urgeri ab hoste vidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <cb n="URIN" /> 2, 25; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 56:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 56, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc Pallas instat et urget Hinc contra Lausus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 433</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urgent impavidi te Salaminius Teucer, te Sthenelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac urget lupus, hac canis angit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 64</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49904.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To weigh</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bear down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at onus urget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">onus aut jam urgentis aut certe adventantis senectutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod latus mundi nebulae malusque Juppiter urget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem scabies aut morbus urget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 453</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo Quintilium perpetuus sopor Urget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 24, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes illacrimabiles Urgentur ignotique longa Nocte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus militiā atque inopiā urguebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesens atque urgens malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:25:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 25, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49904.6" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To urge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">press</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solicit</hi> (syn. insto): <cit><quote lang="la">quod te urget, scelus, Qui huic sis molestus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam atque etiam insto atque urgeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 19, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamobrem, ut facis, urge, insta, perfice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: Lepidus ursit me et suis et Antonii litteris, ut, etc., Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil urget,</quote> <trans><tr>is pressing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur patrem non urserit ad exsolutionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:33" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 3, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49904.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To press</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exert in excess</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vox autem ultra vires urgenda non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 51</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49904.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To press upon</hi> (by too great nearness), <hi rend="ital">to crowd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hem in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne urbem hanc urbe aliā premere atque urgere possitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallis, quam densis frondibus atrum Urget utrimque latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 524</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 566</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quāque pharetratae vicinia Persidis urget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 290</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49904.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49904.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To press</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urge</hi> with argument (a favorite expression of Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">urgerent praeterea philosophorum greges ... instaret Academia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum neque ursi, neque levavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed urges me meis versibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:20:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urguebat Arcesilas Zenonem, cum ipse falsa omnia diceret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:25:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 25, 70</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed urguetis identidem hominum esse istam culpam non deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:31:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 31, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud urgeam, non intellegere eum, quid, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:27:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 27, 80</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut interrogando urgeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:40:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 40, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urgent tamen et nihil remittunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:28:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 28, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 9, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 3, 9</bibl> (also ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 57</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n49904.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To follow up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stick to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ply hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">push forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urge on</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">eundem locum diutius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:35:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 35, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin tu urges istam occasionem et facultatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus, aequitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 16, 67</bibl></cit>: idem illud de provinciis, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et durum terrae rusticus urget opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:8" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 390</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non tacta ligonibus arva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:489" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 489</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:520" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 520</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia ad manes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:419" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romae cum sum et urgeo forum,</quote> <trans><tr>am often in the Forum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. altum, <hi rend="ital">to force</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plunge into</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 2</bibl>.— Urgeri, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be hard pressed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosecuted</hi> for any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">male administratae provinciae aliorumque criminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 29</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">marisque Baiis obstrepentis urges Summovere litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 20</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">urgens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I.B.1.), <hi rend="ital">pressing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cogent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urgent</hi> (postclass. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">urgentior causa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urgentissima ratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">urgenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">pressingly</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 30, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
urica: <entryFree id="n49905" type="hapax" key="u_ri_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūrīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, i. q. eruca, <sense id="n49905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a caterpillar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">canker-worm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 44, § 154</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
urigo: <entryFree id="n49906" type="main" key="u_ri_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūrīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>uro</etym>, <sense id="n49906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lustful heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pruriency</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 215, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1</bibl>, p. 105, 27; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 187</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 87, § 238</bibl>, the correct read. is ustio).</sense></entryFree>
urina: <entryFree id="n49907" type="main" key="u_ri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with Sanscr. vāri, water; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ou)=ron</foreign>; cf. urna and urceus</etym>, <sense id="n49907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">urine.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49907.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 56, § 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:27" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 6, 17, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:313" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 313</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 13, 71, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 80 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 4, 3</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n49907.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitalis,</quote> <trans><tr>seed</tr>, <tr>semen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 43, 68, § 168</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">urina concepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:170" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 170</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 15, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
